The Pad Thai was honestly one of the best I've ever had, and hands down the best in Phoenix. It was spicy, the noodles were sticky and delicious. The chicken was perfectly seasoned and cooked. The presentation was impeccable,

The panang curry was not what either of us are used to as it was red opposed to the normal green, but it was super smooth, almost smoky and crazy flavorful. It wasn't clumpy and very creamy. The only downside was the $2 charge to sub brown rice for the traditional jasmine rice.

I would highly recommend Wild Thaiger to anyone town.

So, I had a bit of a surprise for lunch today. I just landed in Phoenix, I was looking for a little something to eat. I saw that Wild Thaiger was listed on DDD and on Yelp. So I decided to give it a try. The food was, in short, very delicious. The wait staff were extremely friendly. I quite enjoyed a nice leisurely little lunch. It does take a bit of time. That's because I believe they make every dish from scratch fresh. At least, that's what it looks like in the kitchen. It was so busy. But, all in all, pretty worth it. I can't wait to come back and try more. I do recommend the Dragon eggz. Try them both ways, steamed and crispy. The cheesecake was scrumptious with a tropical twist of mango.

I love, love, love the food! We had the ribs pineapple fried rice with chicken pad Thai & a salad shrimp roll with peanut sauce.

The people that work there are super kind and really nice, service was excellent!

This place was a favorite spot of mine whenever me and my coworkers needed a good Thai meal.  Centrally located, parking always available, and the atmosphere is so relaxed.  I tend to go straight for the Pad Thai (which is a great choice here - you will not be able to eat the entire thing in one sitting, even the lunch portion), but everything else I get I enjoy as well.  The one thing that I would watch out for is time constraint.  My coworkers and I used to work right by the restaurant and were a little more flexible with our lunch hour.  However, sometimes I did have to wait a little longer than I felt I should for my food (although they may have just been very busy those few times).  All in all, a good grub spot!

IF YOU CAN'T TAKE THE HEAT... 
Don't expect customer service! Don't expect them to answer the phone if they're busy during normal Business hours. They won't! And they won't apologize for it either! 

I, along with my co-workers wanted to place over 9 food orders for pick up. After several attempts to call and place our order, Wild Thaiger never picked up their phone. So I drove a few miles to place the order in person only to be told that there was a TWO-HOUR take out waiting time! I wish someone would have picked up the phone at Wild Thaiger instead of wasting my gas and time. 

JUST A LITTLE ADVICE Wild Thaiger, ALL your phone-in customer orders deserve the same respect and assistance as your dine-in customers! If you can't handle the heat, then get out of the kitchen! 

My office and I will be taking our business to Thai Hut and Thai Basil!! Maybe that'll help alleviate some of your stress, Wild Thaiger.

After Mexican food Thai the the most numerous type of food in the down town area. With this stiff competition offerings need to be unique.

While Thaiger is on the higher end of the down town Thai spectrum in both prices and presentation.  Most dishes are 7.95 with soup OR spring roll but not both. The vegetarian dishes are 8.95 and some of the noodle ones are closer to $10.

Service was fairly slow, less than ideal at lunch hour and surprising as they were not very busy. Another negative note is the open kitchen. I was able to see one cook use the microwave on something. Microwaves and gourmet never mix.

I had the Veggie Kiewan 8.95 with a spring roll. The spring roll was nothing special. The green curry was quite rich and thick one of the richest in town. The vegies were good as was the tofu this is all topped with a beet garnish. Overall it was a good dish.

My co workers opted for the soup. It was a curry soup with chicken in it. They said it was just ok.

Due to the slower service, microwaves and higher prices I gave it 3 vs 4 stars. If you want to impress a client for a lunch this is the thai place to go to.

Fantastic thai food. It took a while for our service and my thai basil was a bit salty but it still tasted really good and great service.. Its hard to find a good thai place and i like this place very well so far
great drinks- curry is amazing- coconut rice is a must!!!!!!!! love the location wished they had more of a thai atmosphere as far as music goes and longer happy hour

Not the best Thai food. I initially visited this place because it was on Triple D. We tried 3 different dishes
their pineapple fried rice, spicy pad thai, dumplings and  and none were extraordinary mind blowing. Their Milk Boba was average. They have a boba drink made with coconut milk and almond milk. That was probably my favorite part. The parking is a little sketchy, it's behind the building. 

This place is in downtown Phoenix and this area looks like a ghost town on the weekends.

We had been looking forward to trying the Wild Thaiger for months, so I was so glad we finally made it here!

Location: great, if you know what's good for you. Downtown Phoenix has amazing restaurants, and this one is conveniently off Central, south of Thomas. 

Service: mixed. The hostess let us choose a seat on the patio and was very friendly. Dinner service was not very friendly and pretty short, not totally uncommon at Asian food restaurants, but this was pretty curt. Patio service was very sporadic and we frequently found ourselves needing water or other items and there were no servers in site for ten minutes.

Food: we started with the Satay platter, which came with two chicken and beef skewers, and two pieces of shrimp. The temperature wasn't hot enough when it was served and the peanut sauce was heavy, but the overall taste was fine.

Dinner entrees were the chicken pad Thai and gai katchu. The pad Thai was just delicious, served in a huge portion with crisp sprouts and boys of peanuts. It could have used just a tad bit more heat, but hey, I live on the wild side. 
The Gai Katchu was just as good, and we ordered it hot. It was definitely spicy, but had great flavor. Could have used more chicken.

Overall: The food was delicious for the most part, but we couldn't ignore the sub-par service.

I was eager to come back for the pad thai. I review this place ten months ago and was impressed with their pad thai with chicken and shrimp. It seem the pricing has change this time, for shrimp, it is now $3 extra. alright, that's fine. when the dish came out, I was so disappointed. I didn't even see any shrimps and when I did find them, there was only 2!!! $3 extra for two shrimps! the presentation of the dish and taste was not the same and portion was smaller. did they have new chef or new owner? will not come back to this place

Read the reviews ... and agree with most of what I have seen - food is great - service is slow - but - not painfully slow for us.  We were seated right away and received our drinks.  Food was a little slow - but they had a LARGE table - I'm sure that stressed their resources a bit.  We used the time to catch up - so all is good.   I'd much rather receive fresh, hot, tasty food than something thrown together in a hurry just to meet a speed need.  You can tell by watching the kitchen that each dish is cooked to order.  

Two of us ordered the Pad Thai, one a beef salad, and the other a peanut chicken dish.  EVERYONE was pleased with their selection.  I like mine a little spicier - and the condiment jars provided just what I wanted.  We also shared the Island Crab appetizer - and ordered a second!  

Just like Arnold... I'll be back!

By far, one of, if not the best Thai Restaurant in Phoenix, Arizona. We tried all their popular dishes and every one of them wowed us. We tried other Thai restaurant in the area and none of them compare mostly just disappointments. So, if your in Phoenix and your looking for Thai cusinie this is the place to experience local ingredients with a Thai style!

As a traveler of the world, I actually have been to Thailand and have tasted the local cuisine. Nothing compared BUT Thaiger Thai has it pretty close. However, I prefer my tofu steamed not fried and more spicy. I'm not an American  ( no offense to Americans out there but you guys mostly can't handle spicy food). I can handle my spice. Sadly thaiger did not out enough on. It was like putting on black pepper. Next time I will request lots of soice because the combination of flavors they use is exquisite. This place could do better and has so much potential to live up to...your competition is Ewa's in Flagstaff

The Thai Food I tried was unique and different than from other Thai Places I've been too including the sister restaurant The Little Thaiger. 

We sat on the comfortable covered patio.

I tried the crispy spicy Corn Fritters. They were a little sweet, a little spicy and seemed very light in texture almost like eating a rice cake. The cucumber chutney was light and refreshing and went well with the corn fritters. I thought the fritters were very unique and never had anything like them before.

I enjoyed the 24K, it was really delicious Thai Pumpkin, Two kinds of eggplant including Thai, fresh green beans in spicy green curry. I added chicken to the dish and it was prepared well. I thought this dish was delicious but would have been much better if they just added a little fresh basil. 

My husband really enjoyed the Sliced WILD BOAR in HOT red chili sauce. 

Service was very good. We had two servers that both checked on us several times and also offered refills before we even needed them.

Tasty food but I would ask for some fresh basil next time.

3.75 stars

I dined at Wild Thaiger last night with two other people. We were seated on the patio right away. We ordered three dishes and a couple of drinks. The food was great. The flavors and spice level were more authentic than a lot of Thai restaurants I have dined at. 

The four stars I am giving is for the food. Unfortunately, our service wasn't great. The server was very impatient and wanted us to order right away. My drink took about 10min as well. Thankfully the food was the redeeming factor.

The food here is average at best.  I am a little concerned with the overall cleanliness of the kitchen.  It is very small yet they cut flowers and do other non food related things in the same area your food is being cooked in.  I have had to sit at the bar and wait for a table.  I noticed how small the kitchen is and how they do not clean up immediately after themselves.  Some dishes are really good while others are really bad.  Any substitutions and there is a charge.  Not very friendly at all when you can charge someone $2 for peanut sauce with their meal or $1 to add onions or remove bellpeppers.  It is just a real hit or miss here.

Wild Thaiger was a convenient choice for quick and easy take out on a Thursday night I had no interest in cooking.  The menu is somewhat limited in my opinion - no masaman or choo chee curries and no crispy duck, which are my favorite Thai staples .  So I got an order of beef panang, an order of pad thai, and was intrigued by the dragon eggs app.

The dragon eggs were atrocious.  But the pad thai and beef panang were both good.  Not great, not mind blowing, but not horrible.  And for around $10 each they were pretty good sized portions.  I could see myself ordering take out again or actually dining in for a casual meal.

Ona, where are you? Why aren't you tasting the food that your cooks are putting out? Please taste your food!

I love this place and have always loved the food, until last night. We ordered four dishes for take-out and none of them tasted good. They were all bland and the pad thai would be an embarrassment to any self-respecting fan of Thai food. Ona, the owner, was on hand, but I'm surprise she would allow such low quality to ever make it to the customer.

Pad Thai was terrible... very salty, not sweet at all. I ordered mine with fried tofu, there was not one single piece of tofu anywhere in the dish. I twas a vegetarian dish and came with two small pieces of cauliflower and that was it. I couldn't believe my eyes.

I love this place so much I bring all of my out-of-town friends here to eat. When I served this food to my foodie friends yesterday, I was embarrassed and had to apologize profusely. I don't know what was going on behind the scenes yesterday, but someone wasn't doing their job in the kitchen.

Two stars today for a very poor meal last night. Hopefully it will improve and I will be able to give them four stars.
Second time here.  Not disappointed.  Simply delicious.  Had the veggie pad thai.  Tofu was flavorless but the rest of the dish was amazing.  Husband has chicken pad thai...superb.

We went for a quick lunch while I was on my lunch break. Two of us ate like kings for like $20 with their amazing Lunch Specials. I got the Peanut Chicken and my friend got one of the Beef dishes. Plating and presentation were excellent on top of that, making us feel like we really got our money's worth. Also, the soup of the day was AMAZING! It was like a Chicken Mushroom Coconut soup. Highly recommend, would go back any day.

Best thai food in town possibly... like many before me have said the spice is just right, the temple if fire lives up to its name and I love it. 24k while not worth it's weight in gold (seen those gold prices ?)  definitely is my favorite dish on the menu 

The one at minus is simply because the service has been spotty at best and I had one item which I thankfully forgot about which wasn't anything at all. In fact I didn't want to go back till thai Rama had that can plow in and we were at a loss. I'm most definitely glad I did go back and having said that I will keep going back . 
 
Oh and btw that mango cheese cake is the truth. That is legit and I wonder how I went through life not hiking to mix up my fav 2 things mangoes and cheese ! 

Perhaps if they fix up their service I will up it to five stars until then it's a 4.5 place

I was hoping to try the food here before I left the city. Unfortunately, I was turned away at the door, even with empty tables in sight. The hostess informed our party that the restaurant was short staffed and we would have a ten minute wait. No problem. We are patient. With no other patrons waiting to be seated, we requested to sit at a table and would have no concerns about waiting for service while we rested our legs and chatted. We were refused.

In 103 degree heat, we were refused. They were unwilling to allow us to sit inside at an empty table to wait! We questioned this action and the hostess turned to the kitchen, then looked back and said she was not allowed to let us inside.

We were left with the option of standing in the heat while tables remained empty inside, or we could find a place that was willing to accommodate our party. We chose the latter. 

I'm sorry that I will never have the opportunity to review the food here. Even more, I am disappointed that the staff behavior was so appalling. The only interaction with the restaurant that I have to review- a refusal to allow us to sit at an empty table.
Everything was fine, just fine. Service was good, the food was good. The only reason this is a lower rating is because it did not blow me away, but I would likely eat here again.

We had put off going here for quite some time because we feared it would be like most Thai places in Phoenix a disappointment).....but, when we finally went were were pleasantly surprised!  The food was well prepared and there was a nice variety of items on the menu.  They even had my favorite desert, the mango and sticky rice.  We will definitely be going here again!!

This place is incredible but the seating is an issue as is the hostess. When someone walks into your establishment the first thing you should do is greet them not carry on an internal conversation.   When we asked if we could wait at the bar we were told NO because someone waiting may want to sit there. Hmmm when there are 2 seats at the bar I don't think a party of 3/4 or 5 is going to manage that. Then we were told to wait out in the patio where space heaters exist but not turned in. The patio could definitely be used for serving...lost revenue and no one sitting at the bar....more lost revenue.

Fritter me timbers.... 

I mean, corn fritters. 

Not that this one little review makes any difference, but if you go, get the corn fritters. 

This was my second time at Wild Thaiger and how that delicious app eluded me the first time, I will never know. 

Not the biggest fan of their Pad Thai, but that's okay. There are many other very delicious options... And corn fritters.
Great place and loved their panang beef curry. I haven't had such a flavorful panang curry in a long time!  Might go back again this week while I am still in town!

I enjoyed my meal at this restaurant. If it were in Tucson I would get take out here regularly. I ordered the usual suspects panang curry and pad se-eiw. The flat noodles had a nice savory garlic sauce that had the right amount of sweetness. The panang curry had just the right amount of richness. The one thing I did not like was that they put the rice in the panang curry. I like my rice on the side, I don't like it drenched in the sauce before it even gets to the table.

I've eaten at a number of Thai restaurants in the Phoenix area, and this definitely is in the top 3.  The food is great as was the service and it has a cozy patio if you enjoy eating outside or are a smoker.  The price was also reasonable.   They do serve alcohol, although I'm not sure if it was full bar or beer/wine service only.
Many great dishes but the stand out for me: the freshie rolls! The best gluten-free spring rolls in Phoenix!
Service sucks but the food is so worth it we have been coming here for years!!!! It's awesome and the best Thai food we have found. I just wish they accepted reservations.

Service blows.  Got here a few minutes past the lunch hour and tried to order the lunch special.  The server was rude and denied my request referring me to the dinner menu which was several dollars more and did not come with soup or spring roll.  I won't be back.

I was so excited to eat here after watching the food channel and then very disappointed when we came here. Don't get me wrong the staff was friendly and the atmosphere was nice. We chose to eat outside because it was beautiful. We ordered the pork hash and it was delicious. I got a chicken fried rice. I was disappointed in the selection for that and other items. We got the ribs. That was awesome. Mango cheesecake is a cheesecake with mango on top of it. I guess I was expected it to be cooked into it. 

Overall the food is mediocre nothing to rave about.

First off, love Wild Thaiger, food is excellent, service is by in large prompt, courteous, and a relaxed atmosphere. 

However, I had a bad experience, where I witnessed a cockroach walking across the bar in front of me. I voiced my concern to Ola, she couldn't find it. But apologized. I was dissatisfied with this response and wrote her an email expressing my concerns. This is her appropriate, professional abbreviated response.

"As a regular you know we have an "A" rating because we don't have a pest problem.  I will be glad to share the pest inspection reports and monthly service schedule for the last eight years which we have been in business.  It would be a perfect world if I could afford to have enough staff to open all of our boxes in the parking lot and stock all of our products individually to ensure that unwanted pests do not enter our doors. Of course we have discontinued purchasing product from the supplier and they are aware of the problem."

She refunded my money, and we're satisfied, moved on. 

I show up today with my party---and she pulls me out of the restaurant, tells me that "i'm not supporting her business" and that a few days after my email she gets an inspection from the Maricopa County Health Department, and they gave her a "B" rating. She proceeds to accuse me of calling them, and blaming me for her low grade. I inform her that I dealt with her straight, communicated directly with her, and I considered it resolved. At this point she tells me she won't serve me anymore after being a customer for about seven years.

Having never dealt with the Maricopa Environmental Services, I'm not really aware with how they schedule their inspections but clearly it was a coincidence that it occurred 6 days later. I guess Ola never thought perhaps it was a different customer, or in fact that maybe it was scheduled every 3 months?

At any rate her reaction to customer feedback is not only unprofessional but just makes bad business sense. 

Poor decision Ola, I'm really surprised your sanitation problem, and failing an inspection is blamed on your customers.

Ate there recently and the service was very poor: it took 20 minutes to get even a glass of water; others who were seated after us had orders taken before us; and then the food took a long time as well. Choose a different restaurant.

I want to give Wild Thaiger a 5 star because I really love their Pad Thai and spicy fried rice. Seriously, probably best Pad Thai I've ever had. However, there are a few downfalls. The dragon eggs that every one and their mothers seem to rave about were actually very underwhelming. Also, the crab appetizer isn't very good either. You can tell that it's just crab from a can which I'm not down for. Their desserts and drinks are nothing to brag about either. 

We tried their yellow curry one time too when my wife and I went to dinner with our friends and the yellow curry was pretty delish! Also, they have a very confusing seating system where they will have tables available but they won't sit you yet until the kitchen can catch up with the orders. This is kinda strange but at the same time at least that means that they are making all the food fresh. If your looking for some good Thai food in central Phoenix you gotta hit this place up.
Family birthday dinner.  Everyone loved their food.  Not very much for vegetarians... very little in fact.  Otherwise, nice experience again.

Came here for  lunch today with the family after a morning hike,  good food, hit the spot! I had the chicken pad thai with a spring roll and a nice cold Kirin Light beer. Took about 30 mins or so for our food to come out, so don't come here if your looking to have a quick lunch. Sit outside on the patio, relax and enjoy!

This is incredible. I have been coming here for two years. The food was ok sometimes.  They always messed up the order. I felt always being treated bad and had to wait for my order or food for 30-40 min even when I call ahead. 

So tonight I waited for 30 min the waitress never came and then I went to her she said she was told the manager said not to serve me and she should be afraid of my kind of people. I'm middle eastern and brownish. 

I was so hurt the waitress With the blue hair laughed and said the manager can serve anyone they like. The other waitress made a mistake and showed me a note on with my name on it stating not to serve me or my people !!

what they don't know is I order for my staff once or twice a week over 200$ but I always have someone else pick it up. NEVER AGAIN 


VERY HURTFUL  

RACISM IS ALIVE AND WELL IN 2018. 

Very sad. I will not ever support this establishment and I hope you  don't either. 

Racist people come in all shape and ethnicities. DO NOT EAT THERE. 

I'm attaching a picture that was taped on the wall not serve me.

I went Sunday night February 18, 2018 with friends for dinner.  We asked the server for a description of various dishes,  At best, we got one-word descriptions.  She clearly was not interested in helping us.  We had no drink refills the entire meal.  Upon getting ready to pay and leave the server disappeared for at least 15 minutes with our credit cards.  Now  I am going to have to put a fraud alert on my credit card because   who only knows what she was doing with my credit card.  We asked to speak to a manager which took another 15 minutes.  We finally got someone named Dave, who was indifferent  about our complaints. I will never go there again.

Just came across this restra while searching for some good thai food. The veggie sampler whetted my apetite  awesum loved it nd feeling bit high after having saki cosmo; the tofu tower doesn't tower up my expectations. Now finally heading towards main course,..dnt knw hw  they make it but their curry is alwys awesum

I have only been here once, but what I ate was awesome! I love that it's right off the light rail too. We did a "rail day" not too far back where we just jumped on the rail and tweeted as we went. Following recommendations from fellow twitter users we stopped here for lunch and ended up at the heard museum (also right off the rail). All in all a really great day. Good food, good people and a little culture. Gotta recommend all of it!

If you're riding the rail and are in the mood for some thai, this is the place! :)
So surprised that this place wasn't more expensive and that we didn't have to wait for a table. Delish!!

I'm here to review MY experience and THE FOOD.
Came here during a week night. 
Found parking.
No waiting.
Courteous host.
Fast service.
Good food -temperature, flavor, presentation, portion size, price-.

I'm definitely recommending this place and the food. Will be back my next trip to AZ. I had: dragon eggs (crispy), curry chicken and coconut rice. All good.

Delicious thai food.  I tried the tom yum soup which was very flavorful and delicious but a touch on the salty side.  The pad thai noodles were also awesomely chewy and came with tons of mix-ins on the side like peanuts, cabbage, bean sprouts, beets, and cilantro.  A bit too much sauce was on the noodles today, but adding the veggies really helped.  Next time I'm hoping to try the durian ice cream as well ;p

I did not even know this place was on DDD before I tried it today! I have not had much experience with Thai food before, but I did enjoy trying this place out. I sat outside and it was nice, not too crowded on a Wednesday night.
Our orders were taken pretty quickly, I can't remember the name of the dish I ordered, but it was tofu and vegetables in a coconut broth. Was served in a metal bowl that had a flame in the middle which was pretty crazy. Was a little bit difficult for me to ladle the soup from the metal thing into the bowl without making a huge mess. But it went ok! The food was delicious. It was not spicy at all though. Also there were a few slices of what looked like potato in there, and it wasn't potato. It was sliced ginger, and eating that big of a hunk of ginger is not really a pleasant experience. Otherwise, I enjoyed it! Was not too expensive, I'm sure it would be a great place to come for lunch too.

Tacky looking establishment and terrible service. Is this place a joke? There are better places nearby. And don't bother calling g for takeout - they act like they can't understand because they're "so busy." Place looks kinda unpopular to me since I had to walk in to order food. Ugh this place is the worst.
I came here because of Guy. The Dragon's Eggs were great. I also ordered the chicken Pad Thai and I liked the noodles better than the meat. I would come back.

(Lyrics - Survivor - Eye of the Tiger)

Risin' up, back on the street
Did my time at work, took my chances
Went the distance
Now I'm back from my meetings
Just a man and his hunger for some Thai

So many times, it happens too fast
You trade your passion for quick bite
Don't lose your taste on the heat of the spice
You must fight just to keep them alive

It's the food of the Wild Thaiger
It's the scent of the spice
Risin' up to the challenge
Of our belly
And the Yelper known for his song
Orders his plate always right
And he's reviewing with his
Eye on the Wild Thaiger


Wild Thaiger is locally own family restaurant located around the downtown area of Phoenix.  Chef and owner Olashawn Hasadinratana-Weaver brings the traditional flare of Thai food to modern day Phoenix.  Wild Thaiger has had many TV personalities visit the place, but also celebrities that come by PHX.  I know because of the pictures posted in the back wall - haha!  Decorated with traditional Thai art; Wild Thaiger tries to emulate that Thailand feel along with your cuisine.  

I've been here several times once for dinner and once for Happy Hour.  I'm a big fan of the fried noodles mainly Pad See Ew - Stir-fried fat noodles with your choice of protein; chicken, beef, or pork; and of course vegetables.  Seems pretty simple, but this dish packs a punch of aroma and spice.  It's usually fried in a garlic sauce and the amount of heat is based on how much you can handle.  I can't do the Thai spice I'll admit so I always do the medium.  In any case, Wild Thaiger deliveries with the Pad See Ew along with their traditional Pad Thai dish.  Another stir-fried noodle, but this one is with the skinny noodles and it's much sweeter.

Overall, I would come here for Happy Hour because they have 1/2 off appetizers.  Their selection of Thai beer is always interesting something I think you need to try for you beer connoisseurs out there.  Service is always tops and the kitchen which is open for your viewing is spotless - Enjoy!

Went there with a group I'm in.   I had been there before and wasn't all that impressed, but it has been a few years so I thought I'd give it another shot.   I had the yellow chicken curry.   It was okay.   They add some kind of thickener to the sauce, which I don't like it when thai restaurants do that.    Just let the sauce stand on its own.   You don't need to thicken it.   Thankfully, the chicken was not boiled, which is what I had in another Asian restaurant I reviewed.   Ughhh!!  Gross!!   I think twice is enough to try it out, no matter how many years in between.

Great, authentic Thai food in the heart of Phoenix. They are always packed which is a true testament to their food! The service is always exceptional as well. The only downside is DDD was just there last week so expect a much longer wait once the episode airs!

This is a review by a vegetarian.

Also, a review by a single strait main. This may have influenced the star rating and tip because the server was , um, worth a star.

Had the veggie platter. I do appreciate veggie icons on menus to help me scan.

The corn cakes were crispy and not greasy. Though I thought that was an indonesian dish, not thai. Not complaining just trying to figure things out. Ditto goodness on the veggie spring rolls and spicy dipping sauce. Tofu skewers themselves were good but I can and do make a better peanut sauce than that. Just use the spicy sauce for everything on the place.

So that's 3 stars for food and decent price and 1 star for server fantasies + large clean bathroom + convenient parking in the back.

Bonus hygiene: saw cats milling around the rear door of the NEXT restaurant over. So that place lures all the varmints assuring cleanliness at Wild Thaiger.

My husband and I came here for dessert one day and were in a hurry. They sat us right away (they were slammed 5 minutes to close!) made our dessert, cashed us out in under 10 minutes. And it was delicious! Mango with sweet rice is my favorite!

My brother recommended this spot and I'm so happy to have found a delicious Thai spot in AZ for future visits. Beautiful restaurant I would love to dine in next time.  We placed a takeout order during a recent visit. The young lady who helped us was so sweet and super helpful. She even accomodated a special request in making a pad woon sen for us even though it was not on their menu specifically. Fried rice, panang, Pad Thai,  Thai Tea, everything we tried was delicious! If you are new to Thai flavors, this place is great!!  We requested not too spicy and the flavors were just perfect. When I saw that they were featured on Guy Fieri's Diners Driveins and Dives from The Food Network, that made me even more excited to try this place.  I hope to find their episode sometime to watch it. Amazing customer service and a beautiful space to dine inside and outside. Look forward to returning!!!  Ample parking in a private lot behind the restaurant.

Food always great!!  One of the BEST!  But the interior remodel is aweful. The fish tank is such a bad statement. Makes the place look cheap and looks more like other crappy Thai restaurants. Poor choice in a remodel. 86 the fish tank.

Overrated. Service was slow, food was mediocre and a bit pricey for the service/food you get. I had satay chicken and the meat was dry and the sauce was crumbly. Then I ordered the pad-see-ew and it was super salty.
Wifey and I hit the Wild Thaiger up after a trip to the Phx Museum of Art. great choice. Friendly service and modern decor. The food was excellent. Phoenix is lucky to have this place.

Came here for lunch with my friend. 

We got the dragon eggs for appetizers which were very similar in look and taste to Chinese dim sum Siu Mais. The appetizers came out a few minutes after we ordered them. They had jalapeno slices on top though in what appears to be soy sauce. We also ordered thai teas and I ordered an additional watermelon mojito. They were pretty good. The thai teas were good and not as sugary as what I usually get whenever I have a thai tea that has been drenched in creamer. The watermelon mojito was poured a little heavy which, is usually how I have my liquor and had chunks of watermelon in it. Very good. Then my order or chicken pad thai came after I downed my watermelon mojito. 

The time between finishing the appetizers and mojito to when my food arrived was about 7 minutes during lunch time rush...actually pretty good since they were about full inside the restaurant. I'm pretty sure nobody wanted to sit outside in 107 degree weather. Pad thai was delicious but not spicy. It is on the menu as one pepper rating or medium spicy. I usually get thai hot but was pretty hung over from heavy drinking into the morning so I figured getting thai hot was probably not a good idea. 

Over all, a very good experience. Service was fast. Food was delicious and waitress was attentive. Pricing isn't bad but not like super cheap. I would come here again. Parking is decent and in back of the restaurant. I would imagine that during lunch time that parking might be tough to find since you technically can't park in the lot to the left of the restaurant...technically, lol.
The Veggie Spring Rolls were really good!  Our entrees were also delicious & our service was very good.  This is for sure my new spot for Thai food in our neighborhood.

Excellent!

I grew up on Malee's on Main which I think is the best. Living in Tempe & Scottsdale for years...

Having moved to the central corridor I discovered Wild Thaiger. 
As good if not better! Bomb!

Was able to chat with the owner last visit. Love that! She's charming!

Highly recommend!

This cute place is located in downtown Phoenix slightly north of the Heard Museum. It's on Central, easily access via light rail. There is private parking but it's right next to a public lot and can be confusing. Beware to avoid parking in the public parking lot since it requires payment. 

The restaurant itself has Asian inspired interior and appeared to be well maintained. They have a shady, quaint outdoor patio with normal table seating and also lounge seating. They have full table service for both indoor and out. 

Customer service was mixed. One of our servers was a little short and wasn't helpful with the menu. Another one of our servers was very kind and attentive. The food was prepared very quickly so wait was minimal. The food itself was average. I enjoyed the flavors and thought the dishes were presented well. However, the flavor was average and the curry was served on a dish, which I think is mildly annoying since it's a bunch of fluid spread over a large surface area. The items come with a default spicy level but can be changed to cater your taste.

This place is amazing. A friend brought me here when I was visiting from out of town and I was really impressed. This may be my new favorite Thai food place. They have a ton of creative options on the menu that look delicious. When I told the waiter I was a vegetarian, he said that they could make 90% of things vegetarian. I asked whether that included using beef broth and fish sauce and he clarified that they use vegetarian broth and a veggie substitute for the fish sauce for all of the veggie dishes. Amazing! I got a delicious noodle dish that I'm now craving again. My friend got peanut chicken and sticky rice with mango, both of which looked delicious. I would definitely recommend this place.
We went here bc it was on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives! Yum!! Tried the pork skewers and the spicy seafood fantasy dish. Really, really good. The jasmine coconut rice is delicious:-)

I Was really impressed with the service and the food. Papaya salad... Yes please. I took an extra order home with me. Their coconut ice cream was amazing too!
Parking was a little shady, however that's what DT phoenix offers for parking. greeted with a smile at the door and everything was very organized. I'll be back!

I've been looking for a Thai restaurant to replace the legends in Portland and this is the closest replacement I've found. Overall I was pretty impressed in the food. Their version of spicy wasn't very spicy but they had bowls of dried pepper powder to help me adjust the temperature to my liking. I will be visiting again.

I actually want to get this place zero stars but that is not an option. I went here with my family my aunt and uncle words are from out-of-town and I had suggested this place because I have had the food there before and it was very good. We got to the restaurant at a decent time on a Monday night there was three other tables, we asked to down in one of the empty booths but she told us that we could not. That we had to wait. . We looked around and couldn't figure out why it was a 25 minute wait. We said okay we would like to sit down the bar and have a drink my uncle and aunt enjoy a nice glass of wine. The waitress who was very rude, told us that if we sat down at the bar to have a glass of wine that we cannot sit at a table. We looked to her completely confused she said that we could not dirty two areas of the restaurant. I couldn't believe what I was hearing! We said okay and could we sit at a table, that we will stay at for dinner,  we will understand if they couldn't get to us for the 25 minutes we can still sit and have a drink, she said no we have to stand there or sit on the bench waiting for a table for the 25 minutes or we cannot eat there!!!!  We left the restaurant and I will never return. I have now read the reviews how the service has sank. It's sad because it was a very enjoyable place at one time. Big fat F for this place.

Great choice for lunch in Phoenix! I ordered the Pad Thai which was the perfect amount of spice. I've never finished an entire plate at a Thai restaurant, but I did here. The portion was decent but not gigantic like other restaurants in the area. 

Everyone's food looked fabulous at our table, I can't wait to try more!

I have only been to Wild Thaiger a few times and have eaten food they catered for a private buffet dinner at the restaurant most of those times. The Pad Thai is a favorite of mine. I love their Iced Thai Tea. The atmosphere is nice, the service is top notch and the food is constantly good. They also have a full bar with happy hour.
Went there on a first friday night, they were slammed but the waitress was still very attentive.  We ordered pad thai, tom ka gai and sticky rice, all three were delicious!  Great patio too.

DDD gave this place rave reviews.  It was crowded.  No doubt because of DDD.  The item Guy loved was "no available" when we were there.  I would have left if I had been alone, but it was girls lunch so we all ordered something different to taste each other's food.  100% disappointment all around.  The staff was rude and inattentive.  They were busy.  But I've worked in restaurants, staff should be nicer when they are busy because we waited forever for our drinks...then our food...then her food...then her food...then chopsticks... you get the idea. One of us was almost done before mine even arrived at the table. This is Emperors New Clothes for sure.  I just want all of you to know the Emperor is naked and all the food we tasted was mediocre at best.
Kind of regret going here. Female servers had major attitude. They all look related. Food was good but entree portion was super small and overpriced. Won't be coming back. Sorry.

Been here twice.  Loved it both times!  Actually today, my brother mentioned he has been there for dinner and wants to take us there to try it.  We beat him to this place.  Now, we just need to pick a date for dinner.  I can not wait!!!

In the land where many of the Thai restaurants simply rotate proteins, carbs and a standard vegetable medley, Wild Thaiger dishes out more authentic versions of traditional Thai specialties.  I'm a huge fan, especially given that it's proof in and of itself that Thai food is more than just a combo plate - it's an explosion of flavors amalgamated into unique and colorful profiles and textures.  It's an adventure.

Wild Thaiger offers some of my favorites that are not to be found at Thai Basil (so mediocre) and Thai Elephant (good but standard) - Dragon's Eggs are a spin on Kanom Jeeb, thai pork and crab dumplings similar to shu mai, graced with a spicy slice of raw jalapeno on top.  Decha Boar celebrates the not often served wild boar in a peppery sauce of basil and telicherry peppercorns.  They understand that pepper can be flavorful in addition to hot, and there's a whole taste profile there just waiting for you to explore.  Best of all, the presentation on the dishes is a work of art - ribbons of carrots and beets as edible garnishes remind you of what a treat it should be to dine out.

If you are looking for standard Thai, without flair or panache, I could see how this might be seen as too expensive.  But for my money, I'd rather blow my tastebuds out of the park with a mindful chef who prepares her curries and sauces with finesse and grace.  Yum to the freakin' yum.

We visited (party of 3) on June 23rd.  Arrived at 5:50 p.m. and were immediately sat (inside - too hot to bed outside).  

Pro's:  the presentation of the food was amazing!  Presentation was only outdone by the taste - all entree's were very delicious.  I had the Gai Katchu and honestly wanted to lick the plate clean to get the remainder of the sauce!  We split a hefty slice of the Mango Cheesecake - it was simply yummy!  The staff were very friendly and made wonderful recommendations.

Con's:  it was a little dark and as time went by, all the inside seating was full and the noise level was too high to have a normal conversation - we almost had to yell at each other in order to be heard.  As others have noted, there was simply not enough staff considering the number of guests.  We ordered our drinks at 6:00 p.m. - delivered at 6:20 p.m.  When delivered, we placed both our appetizer (house salad) and entree orders.  The salads arrived at 6:40 p.m. with out entrees arriving at 6:55 p.m.  The staff was very friendly - just need more staff!  

Looking forward to returning - and even if there is a long wait - at least I know the food will be delicious and make it worth the wait.
I am visiting Phoenix and found this gem. The pad thai is one of the best I have in years! Will keep coming back.

Pretty good but not tons of veggie-based options.  

Parking: Though it does not seem like it, there are plenty of parking spots when you drive towards the back of the restaurant. That said, if it got super busy, I do not know where folks would park. 

Service: It's OK...it varies depending on when I've gone.  That said, if you want to linger and chat, the servers do not hover or make you feel like you should leave, which is nice. 

Seating: Booths/tables, bar, and outdoor patio. The outdoor patio is nice but can be noisy with passing traffic, and the light rail passes often with its bells. 

Food: I do not eat meat, so that poses limitations for my intakes.  That said, I chose a dish that had eggplant (I dislike eggplant), and they were able to add whatever veggies I requested.  The dish also contained pumpkin, which was not very good, but the broccoli and other veggies were tasty.   I have been here before and ordered the Tom Yum soup, which is often my testing point of a Thai restaurant. It's quite good and extra spicy.   My date ordered some meat-based dish. He seemed to enjoy it.  

I have ordered appetizers here before and enjoy the fresh rolls and corn fritters.   The corn fritters are super greasy, though. 

The cost seems rather decent for a restaurant of this caliber.

Went to Wild Thaiger two nights ago, I have been before, but my girlfriend had not. I love Thaiger so I wanted to share the tastiness. I figured I would write a review since I have not yet.

Wild Thaiger is in the heart of uptown Phoenix. Central and Thomas area. Cool little restaurant with a nice atmosphere inside.

Food is great and very fresh. I like that you can see the entire kitchen from most of the tables in the restaurant. They have nothing to hide. Prices are pretty standard at between 8.95-14.95 for dinner entrees. 

Great food and wonderful service. Nice change from other Thai restaurants in Tempe, Chandler, Mesa, etc.

I've gotta say, not super impressed. The spot is cute and the food is ok. I got the chicken pad Thai and spring rolls. Spring rolls were kind of soggy. The pad Thai was good though. Really flavorful. Could have done without all the cilantro and garnishment. I prefer Thai Basil.

We spent 20 minutes here tonight waiting to be sat only to walk out...

We were told it would be about 15 mins. We waited patiently at the hostess stand, while a seemingly harried and unorganized staff ran around between the indoor and outdoor spaces. Various tables were empty and not being bussed, and another table was actually cleaned and ready. No clue what was going on...there was no one at the hostess stand, no apparent 'leader' to be seen. 

Hoping it was just an off night...when I return to give them a second chance I still update my review

Dragon balls-deep fried shumai type appetizer. The solid pork shrimp filling reminded me of a super mashed meat formed into a ball. I didn't see what everyone thought was so special. 

Tilapia with green curry- 5 stars. Excellent pieces of tilapia, crisp not super greasy crust. Intricate curry ingredients but not sure if the green curry paste was home made, I think it's the canned variety.

Dessert pancake/roti- 1 star, frozen Malaysian parathas which were undercooked and doughy. I was disappointed as this dessert is rare to come by at Thai restaurants in the US
The white chocolate raspberry cheesecake is a masterpiece.  Yes, this Thai restaurant has the best cheese cake I've ever tasted.

This place is awesome.  We went here to try something different and I'm glad we did.  It is kinda far for us but it was well worth it.  Cute place, has a nice outdoor patio, small inside but that doesn't bother us.  I'm just glad it wasn't super busy.  We went on a Saturday night and we were sat right away.  Ordered a few drinks and it did take some time to get them but that's ok.  The employees were all busy and doing their job.  We ordered the Dragon Eggs for an app and did half steamed/half fried and they were AWESOME.  I would definitely recommend them.  For dinner I had Mu Yang, which was INCREDIBLE.  The sticky rice, OH MY, I wish I could have some with every dinner.  My boyfriend ordered the ribs and he loved them.  I tried them myself and I thought they were super tasty.  Everything we ordered had so much flavor, which is huge in our book.  We will definitely be back.

This truly is a jewel from the east. The food is exceptional and fair priced. The Thai tea is to die for and the chicken do good. Parking is a bit tricky but the place is good. If you're looking for authentic Thai food then this is the place to go. Highly recommended.
Definitely recommend.  Shrimp Pad Thai was the best. Would love to try the Mango Cheesecake next time.

Wow! 
This restaurant is fabulous!  The food is very authentic and savory.  With a huge menu selection and warm sweet smiles this now a favorite place to dine. 
I like spice and fresh ingredients and I was totally in love with every bite. 
Thai flavored are among the most complex and delightful in the world and this place delivers a rich and satisfying meal. Portions are big and presentation perfection.  Service is fast and friendly. 
Feels and tastes like being in a gourmet restaurant in Thailand.  
Love Love Love it!

It's been a while since I've been to the Thaiger. Service was terrible. I won't get into that the biggest disappointment was the amount of microwave use. Nothing was really fresh. The waitress had to cash me out with her wallet. To bad.

I've eaten here a few times and I must say that the customer service and food are inconsistent.  One time I had the pad-se-eew and panang, which was good.  The service was great.  Then there was another time I came and the service was lacking.  We weren't even acknowledged for quite some time.  I ordered the pad-se-eew and all I can taste is crunchy garlic bits.  It was horrible.  I took it back and they replaced it.  I also strongly advise to not order the thai iced tea.
Food was very good but the service was slow. Even though our server was nice, it took too long for our food too come out.

We followed Guy's record momentarily on the food at it was great. Would recommend the Dragon Eggs, steamed and fried. Was not expecting to love the papaya salad but it was excellent also. Pad Thai was ok, Thai ribs were very tender and the chicken on the sticks was great. Would recommend to everyone.

I have been to the Wild Thaiger several times and I decided I should write a review because it is such a great restaurant. I went for lunch this time and the service was great. Although it was slightly loud, the food more than made up for it. Started out with lettuce wraps and ended with pad Thai. It was amazing! Very tasty :)

Still my favorite Pad Thai in Arizona.  I normally just get pad thai from any thai place I visit but my friends got me to try the beef panang and it is really excellent.  I love this place.  The wait for your food can be long at lunch but its worth it.

This was the first Thai food I had since my trip to Thailand and it was very good.  I liked that they have Thai servers, it made the food more authentic.  It can get very busy and loud especially at lunch time.  

I would recommend the Thai Tea, all beer they have is tasty, and everything i've ordered food wise was delicious.

Like any small restraunt it pays to go at the right time. I personally love The Wild Thaiger, their food tastes authentic and is equally delicious. Love their variety of Asian Beer served in Frosted Glass. But it is true I have waited a long time for service once, lucky me and my partner weren't in a hurry. Wait staff can be nice just depends who it is. Try there Mango Schnaps drink--wowee--Time will fly in a jiffy then.

The food was good, but  maybe we should have left when they could not describe any of the menu items to us, may been a language barrier but even so they need to know how to explain to a customer what they're ordering. We have been here before service and food was very good. This was a Saturday night not overly busy there at 5 o'clock the service was nonexistent No refills on coffee, iced tea, water asked for them never got them and then to kick it all off they took a credit card and were  gone for 15 minutes. When we tried to talk to the manager about it he was lackadaisical and didn't seem to care about any of it he said well what do you want me to do did not offer to talk to his waitstaff did not offer anything it took him more then 10 minutes we asked if we were going to get to the talk to the manager and she said well he's busy and I said well if he's too busy to come and speak with us I mean I can go ahead and post a review on yelp and other places without talking to him. He finally did come up by his lackadaisical attitude in the customer service field was beyond my anything I have experienced in a long time and phone calls will be made tomorrow.

The food was amazing. It was the fact that we stood there for twenty minutes and no one, literally, no one acknowledged our presence. We sat ourselves in a reserved table, and they told us they were short a cook and that was the reasoning behind the reservation signs. I would have rather been seated, had them explain the lack in staff and just waited longer for my food. This situation could have been handled in a more tactful manner. I will try again, hopefully I can give it five stars next time.

I came in right when they opened. There was quite a line before they opened, and even once we got in it took a bit for us to get any sort of service. 

I ordered the Gaprao Gai. They really don't mess around with their heat level. Be careful! The dish itself was very tasty, and once the lunch rush calmed down service was wonderful (and constant enough to get my water filled up often).

All in all, tasty food, good service. If you are in the area it is worth a shot. Otherwise there are better Thai places around the valley (Chanpen comes to mind...).

We waited 45 minutes for our food. I asked how much longer it would take and was told up to 10 more minutes. I asked if the management would give us a discount for the wait. I saw our very friendly waitress approach her manager who was clearly annoyed by the question  (we made eye contact more than once). The waitress came back and said she was really sorry but they can't do anything about the wait because everyone else is waiting too. So we canceled our order, and they made us pay for the tea we drank!
Now I know it wasn't much but when I've had a problem like this at other restaurants, the manager always comes over to the table and hears the grievance personally. The wait staff was great but the management was sloppy and hands off.
So we drove all the way to Siam Thai (which was pretty busy) and had an excellent meal which was served promptly.
I would never imagine a dine-out could turn into a torment. But I experienced it at Wilder Thaiger. Mind the skinny young Asian waitress.

Decided to visit this place because a friend of mine just started working here, Kristin, she alone is worth a visit to this place. Kristin has such an upbeat personality and a beautiful smile, make sure you ask her when you go and tell her Amber sent ya !!

The restaurant has a huge patio facing Central Ave and the inside is decorated very tastefully. They have a nice selection of wines, specialty cocktails, and beer ( mostly Asian imports ). 

My husband and I ordered :

The Temple of the Thaiger- delicious and described as a party in your mouth, and it was. Perfectly seasoned chicken layered on fried won tons.

Satay Sampler- This was shrimp, chicken, and beef covered in a peanut sauce and was very yummy.

Freshie Rolls- we had the chicken and the veggie and both were soooooo good, this is a must try !

Jasmine rice- steamed to perfection.

All food is made to order and is fresh and delicious. This is a family owned and operated business with Thai born chefs that really know what they're doing. It is a little pricey for Thai food, but the quality and flavor make it worth it. They also have several lunch specials for $7.95 from 11-2 Monday thru Friday.

This place was highly recommended by our friends and we were hoping to also like it. First off, I called and asked if I could bring a small birthday cake for my husband's birthday. The lady on the phone said it was not an issue. We got there and it was packed on a Friday night. The hostess said it would be 20 minutes for a table. Literally two seconds later, there was a four person table cleared. I asked for the table and she got someone to clean it for us. The place was busy and noisy.  The menu was limited and average priced for most items. I craved noodles so ordered the Pad-Seiw. The noodles were alright. Somehow seems like there should be basil in the dish and not a bunch of cauliflower. The hubby had the bbq chicken with coconut rice.  Later our server later came back to tell us that they were going to charge us 5 dollars for bringing our own cake. Nice how that was not mentioned on the phone or when she first took the cake to the fridge for us.  So sadly we will not be returning. Thai Rama has much better food and service.

I'm truly disgusted by the service of this restaurant.  I came in with my family (Mom and Dad) and they said 10 minute wait, we said okay, we notice that they were short with their staff so we waited patiently till we were seated at a table, but that 10 minutes turned into a 30min wait. So the hostess sat us at a table saying how there may be awhile wait, after seeing 2 servers walk by us like we didn't exist, the hostess later seated another table which were 4 Caucasian customers, we were still patiently waited for around another 30min, when those 4 sat down an Asian waiter quickly came to take their order, I got the waiters attention and said excuse me, we came here first. And she made up an excuse saying how "Oh we wait on different tables probably your waiter is busy" I knew this was an excuse, I was so disgusted. So we told the hostess that this waiter is waiting on a table after us, and she said oh well we said there would probably be a long wait, and the hostess had the audacity to say "Oh but they serve the people who come before" and I said, we were before them, we been waiting 30min at this table and you know this because you sat us at our table" she said it depends. So in the end we left the restaurant hungry and went to a much better restaurant which served us very well, called Rice Paper.
Oh, Gaprao Gai, how I love thee.  Nom.

Good God.   Really?  If I lived here I would eat there once every week.   I got the green papaya salad with tamarind sauce to start.  I have had this in other places but they can't hold a candle to these guys.  My entre was the Peanut Passion.   Thin sliced, perfectly cooked chicken with a nice peanut sauce on a bed of fresh cooked veggies with a nice amount of white rice.... I just ate and my mouth is watering.

The knocks?  The dirty martini was poorly constructed and the bar top was a bit dirty.   I would not take a star off though because this is 6 star on a 5 star scale.   Do yourself a favor and eat here not corduroy

You wouldn't expect it, but the ribs here are amazing.  The fried tofu is great, the sauce they have is sweet and sour, but a nice bitter note to cut it off(for another bite).  I really love spicy food, so I enjoy being able to just get the spiciest versions of their dishes.

The food last Friday was terrific. Local friends took us. I like Thai but am not well versed. I tried the Gai Katchu and cleaned my plate. I asked them to bump it up to 2 chiles and it gave just enough heat w/out burning later on. I also tried the Thai iced tea as recommended by our friends. It is sweet, but not too much, and fantastic. Service average +.

Definitely not your regular Thai place...lots of unique dishes and beautiful presentation.  Good food, friendly wait staff, cozy interior, and nice patio.  Perhaps it's the trendy-ness of the restaurant or the presence of a little one attached to me but I don't find myself saying "Let's go to Wild Thaiger" that often anymore.  Definitely more of a trendy "date night" romantic spot than a kid-friendly casual place!

This is tasty Thai in the heart of downtown Pheonix. However, it's not very spicy!! And they were reluctant to give us the good stuff ie. chopped Thai chilis in fish sauce. But when we turned up the heat it was much better. You must try the 24K pumpkin curry which has a very rich and flavorful sauce. Drink the coconut cove cocktail if you love coconut water - it's SO refreshing if your sitting on the hot patio. Also, the pad Thai is a bit sweet so ask for limes to squeeze into it. Enjoy!
Awesome place. Visiting from San Diego and this place didn't disappoint. Fresh ingredients, great portions for the price. Excellent customer service. Nice atmosphere.

We went here for a second time with all 3 of our kids last night and it was a big hit. The first time was with just our daughter who was around 1 at the time. It was a pleasant experience with good service. Last night we brought my 9 year old step daughter who is the pickiest eater I have ever seen. She ordered a noodle dish with sweet soy sauce (she tried to get it without soy sauce but the waitress convinced us it would have no flavor). When it came she made a face but then tried it and loved it! I also had some and was very impressed. It had a lot of fresh veggies and a generous amount of chicken. The veggie spring rolls were also a hit with her and my now 2.5 year old and 9 month old. It was kid friendly. The Tom Kah soup was delicious (my fianc's favorite!) and we split the ribs which fell of the bone and were so tender. The kids fried chicken meal was generous and both kids loved it. The vegetables were all fresh. And the waitress was sweet. We will come back!

It's hard to go wrong with Thai food. So we deviated from our regular spot to check this place out. 

The food was okay, we got a couple staple items (regular chicken curry, and chicken and mushroom coconut soup) the curry was good, but lacked spice. The soup had a little more heat , but still not enough and lacked flavor honestly. 

The service was slow, but not too bad. They were certainly polite. 

It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either.
I love this placetry the coconut drink .nice atmosphere and food is great . Would recommend this place for sure

I ordered the Beef Panang... Yum! Now you might be thinking it's really hard to mess up a staple Thai dish but you can. It was very delicious and the beef was very tender. Most places you go the beef is dry and overcooked. The only complaint I had was that I wish it was a bit spicer. But that's easily fixable. I would definitely come back and try the other dishes.

I have to go with a solid 4 stars on this one because even if the food is not spicy enough for you, there are so many other reasons to love it.

The atmosphere is great.  I like everything from the tables and booths to the patio.  It is easy to hang out and have a good meal with friends, or to tuck yourself away in a corner...

The service has always been top notch for me.  I have been there when I was in a hurry, and I was able to eat and run without having to beg for service.  I also have had long leisurely dinners and was always happy with the attentive, but not pushy service.

I LOVE their pad thai.  It's a little different from the other places I have gone, in a good way.

I'm only sorry they have had such a time with the construction outside their door.  a nice place doesn't deserve that hassle.
Honest private business, honest price, superb food!! Second time here. No disappointment!

The food is ok.  The much promoted Dragon eggs are nothing more than a Chinese siu mai (deep fried or steamed) with a jalapeo on top of it.  All the dishes we ordered, standard...have really no spice level or flavor in the meat.  The service is ok. I wouldn't go out of my way to dine here, to me this was a miss even if Guy Fieri featured on Triple D.
Flavorful dishes and Martini Mondays!  That makes me f-cking estatic!  The Thai waitress is not that friendly, but loved my Vietnamese friend and treated us well so I was happy.

OK, I didn't want to go here because the name sounded like "wild thingy", which sounds like bad porn movie.  Also, looked pretty sketch from the outside, but I have learned that is pretty common in Phoenix.  My Thai craving kicked in and I had to have some "thingy."

It was packed inside for a weekday night, which is a good sign.  My tom yum soup and spicy basil chicken were right on the mark.  I think this would be a great carry out place and from all the sacks lined up, I guess everyone else likes to eat "thingy" too!

I had a take-out order of tofu veggie pad thai. I have to say it's not right for me. Way too sweet. I understand that every Thai restaurant makes pad thai differently, but I think that it should still have at the very least a primary soy sauce taste with a hint of tamarind sour. I may come back to try something different.
The best Thai in the Phoenix...  This place could hang with the best in the country.  Highly recommend the salad rolls and boat.

This is a nice little place with a great atmosphere and a really welcoming interior.  Decorations are great.  As you're traveling North on Central, you have to pass the restaurant and then take a quick right-hand turn into their parking area.  If you park in the lot South of the location you'll get towed.

Food was fantastic.  It was really, really fantastic.  Everything was fresh and natural.  they have quite a few gluten-free items as well, which was great to see.  Spring rolls were delicious.  Gluten-free Chicken Pad Thai was top-notch.  Chicken curry was downright delicious.  Price was right, and we did not leave hungry!

Their service was what knocked them down to 4 stars.  Reading the other reviews, I have to agree with what has been said before.  Place was empty at 11:30 AM on a Saturday and the service was SLOW and kind of "space case."  The young lady who served us looked like a manga cartoon, to include hair and makeup, and if that is fashionable, that is great (I guess) but she sort of pulled an attitude with the gent who was also working that day.  Not sure if he was a server, but he was certainly stepping in because she wasn't up to par.  When he mentioned a concern from another table, she got a little snotty with him in front of us and several other customers.

If we're in the area we'll certainly stop by again.  Food was delicious, and NOT HOT AT ALL, which was great for us.  I understand that if you really want them to "bring the heat" all you have to do is ask, but our super-sensitive stomachs were MORE than pleased with the "base-level" spice.  We'll make sure to attend during a slow time, however, because if the service was that slow with only a few people in attendance I can't imagine how it is when the place is packed.

Went there for Valentines day and got the Wild Boar. Good stuff! We were about 20 minutes late for our reservation, but they still took care of us hassle free even though they were busy. It's nice, clean and professional with great food at a nice price. Have not been disappointed after a sufficient number of visits.
Closes restaurant to one of my favorites in Las Vegas "Archies Thai" that I have been able to find in Phoenix.  Panga curry is top notch..
Amazing everything. The crab wontons were  delicious. Everything was homemade and tasted great.

Definitely has some menu items that you can't get anywhere else. The atmosphere is a bit weird, but pretty solid Thai food. 

I would have given it 3 stars, but they have a beer called PHUKET. I laughed my a$$ off at that. 

"Cry two tears in a bucket, Phuket"!

Tropical Fried Rice -- Amazing! They can substitute the chicken with Tofu which is perfect for us vegetarians, and the rice is just so addictive. You can't stop eating it. They don't overdo it or overcook the vegetables, and it's a perfectly balanced meal. I love everything about this place.

The owner, additionally, is very nice and very modest. You can barely tell that he runs one of the best thai places in downtown phoenix. Hands down, my favorite dinner option in central phx. You will come here and be impressed.
My girlfriend and I accidentally found this place and it was the best accident ever! The Pad Thai and Chicken Curry was absolutely amazing and the Dragon eggs were delicious! Definitely Going back!

We found this place through watching triple Ds. Since we were on a road trip and driving through Phoenix on 10/16/2017, we thought we would stop and try it. This was the best Thai food I've eaten so far. We brought some family with us and they loved the food also and said they would be back. The service was very good and very friendly and helpful. I wish this place was closer to where I live in Texas.

This place has been bookmarked for years and my friends and I met here for lunch today. I was excited to order one of their vegetarian lunch specials (of which there are 4). We arrived and were promptly seated and when our waitress asked for our drink choices, we also gave our orders (tofu veggie panang, beef panang, and tofu pad thai). It took about 20 minutes for our dishes to come out, since we arrived at noon and it was already busy. There were still a few empty tables and there is plenty of outdoor seating, which would be nice when the weather gets cooler. Everything looked great and it tasted even better. I loved my dish, the tofu panang. It was spicy enough and I liked the veggies and the sauce. The spring roll was tasty and it was a filling dish overall. 

Our waters were filled often and service was good. I would go back and try other items on their menu. I usually order pad thai whenever I visit a Thai restaurant and I'm so glad I tried something else this time because it was delicious.
Pad Thai here is the best. I usually did take out and the pad Thai still tasted good when I had it at home.

DDD Destination. 

Best Pad See Ew Ive had. It seems that they really pace seating so that the chef isn't overwhelmed.
My favorite Thai place!   I rarely eat meat/picky with meat I eat  but the chicken here is always perfect! So delicious, friendly staff and great location!

Super good Thai food !! Once you come here you'll never go to Pei Wei again ! Smells DELISH upon walking in , friendly service , clean modern atmosphere .. Decent prices , food is fresh and Taste amazing ! We had the Chicken pad Tai , Mu Yang (the guy Fieri item ) and a couple drinks , highly recommend the leeche martini. Can't wait to come back to try something new :)

I love the restaurant's billboard out front - tiger eyes peering at you, an invitation to try cuisine from faraway lands. This is what brought my husband and myself in. The parking lot is rather small, we were lucky it wasn't too busy. I can imagine it would be difficult to find parking if it was a busy night. 

When you first enter, you have the option of dining inside (to your left) or outside on the covered patio (right). We decided to sit outside since it was such a lovely evening. I ordered an iced Thai coffee - which was delicious. For an appetizer, my husband ordered the Dragon Eggz - dumplings with pork. These came out promptly and were tasty. For dinner, I ordered the Ginger Fish - breaded salmon with mushrooms, pineapple, onions, etc in a ginger sauce. Big mistake. The salmon was more breading than fish and was swimming in the sauce - which I didn't particularly care for. It was a disappointment, but I'd like to come back and try something different since so many other Yelpers seem to enjoy this restaurant.
Really great Thai. The menu was diverse, creative, while also maintaining traditional plates. I very much enjoyed eating here and can't wait to visit again.

Mouthwatering food.

I have been here a few times, as it is walking distance from my office. 

The first time I ordered the vegetarian panang curry. Delicious and spicy. My only issue is I was sweating profusely on the walk back to the office. 

The last couple times I ordered the veggie pad thai. So scrumptious! They plate it beautifully. They use a good variety of fresh veggies... not just the standard broccoli and carrots. Lots of zucchini and cauliflower. Yum. The sauce has a lot of fresh garlic. It is so delectable. May be the best pad thai I have had in Phoenix.

Service is prompt and friendly. For lunch I am in and out under 40 minutes. They keep the fresh iced tea flowing...

I can't help but growl when co-workers ask me where I ate for lunch. "Wild Thaiger... rowl!"
The food was amazing,  got the hot pot with coconut sticky rice..omg. Dragon eggs were as delicious as promised and the fresh rolls were terrific.

The lunch menu is perfect. They are fast for a sit down restaurant and very helpful. I love the pad thai. My daughter loves that they make octopus hot dogs. I have never eaten here besides for lunch but I think it would be a good place to stop as well.

The food was honestly 4-star worthy, SO tasty. 

BUT because they accidently glutenated me, I'm going to give it a bummer three-stars. I asked the waitress if anything was gluten free and she said, "the pad thai. all the people ask for it. it's safer". I knew after the word "safer" I was in for a real treat. The pad thai was amazing, but then after feeling strange, I called back and asked probing questions about what was in it. I argued with the woman over fish paste, and she said the fish paste had wheat in it...and it was in the pad thai, yet the pad thai was gluten free? EEK. If you're a celiac, be careful and just go through the ingredients of what you want to order. 

The hot tea was amazing, and they offer the honey sugar packets - great! 

If you're not gluten-free - FOR SURE GO HERE FOR THAI! It's amazing. If you are, just be very very careful!

This was my first experience with Thai food and I am proud to say I am now a believer!  Showed up at 8:30 on a Tuesday night, the hours said they closed at 9:00 so I was a little worried they wouldn't be very happy with us but we were greeted with a smile and taken to a table.  It took a little bit longer than normal for our waitress to come take our order but she was especially friendly so it wasn't too bad.  We ordered the Turtle Island Crab appetizer, I got the Beef Mangone (I didn't want something too crazy on my first adventure with Thai food!) and my friend ordered the Pad Cha Seafood.

The Turtle Island Crab was amazing!  My only issue with it is that I wanted more!  The wonton crackers were perfectly crispy, the crab and avocado blended together great and the dipping sauce that it came with was sweet with just a little kick.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it again!  My Beef Mangone was equally as impressive when it came out.  The presentation itself was beautiful and once I dug in, the flavor didn't disappoint either.  The beef was tender, the sauce had a bit of a kick but nothing crazy and the veggies were cooked perfectly and complemented the meat nicely.  I was nervous to try my friend's Pad Cha Seafood because it had been rated 3 peppers which equates to "Thai Hot" but I was glad I got the courage to do so because it was delicious too!  Everything was again cooked perfectly and the sauce was pretty hot but not unbearable.  I can't wait to go again and find something else to try!

By far the best Chicken Pad Thai I've ever had. Very inexpensive compared to other places I've been when I've noticed this tends to be a more expensive city/area than even Austin. The spring rolls were average, but I'm more a fan of traditional Chinese style rolls.
My daughter and I enjoyed the Satay Sampler, Super Soup and Pad Thai noodles.  All delicious, great atmosphere, we were very satisfied.

The food is delicious. The prices are fair, (this is one of the fancier Thai restaurants I've been to) the thai tea is extra great, the people who work there are really friendly, so all around we're happy to go to this restaurant. The one star I knocked off is because sometimes you have to wait for your server to come around, but it's definitely not so bad you want to leave. They have a lot of customers which goes to show it's a good place to eat :)

Food: 4.5 stars.  Service: 2.5 stars.  Excellent food, decor and presentation.  Seafood panang curry includes jumbo shrimp, oysters, scallops and squid; it does not come with enough rice though for the curry.  Mediocre service.  I really want to give this place 4-5 stars, but the long wait (even on a busy Saturday night) ruins the whole dining experience for hungry people.  We had to wait 45min for our seafood panang curry and pad thai while the table next to us that seated 10min after us got their appetizer, soup and main dish before us.  One waiter seemed to be doing everything from being in the kitchen to serving food to asking how things are and working the cash register (he was awesome!).  Hostess at the front door did not have any personality at all, and didn't say anything or come by throughout the night.  Another waiter only came by once to fill our water, and that was when we were almost done with our meal.

This place is great . Good food BUT SERVICE IS BAD.. Takes too long to get food and not enough staff to take care of customer. They need to hire a hostess and a busser to make things easier. Been there 3 times and food always great but service ALWAYS slow. And on the menu lunch are $7.95 but you are billed $9.95. Go figure. Any please fix it.

Really great taste and value for lunch special! I got the Yellow Curry Chicken with spring roll for $7.95. It was really yummy and not too hot. We sat on the patio on a very pleasant afternoon. Nice server.

Wanted to try this resturant after seeing it on Food Network....wait was about 30 minutes, dragon eggs were excellent. I've had better chicken pad thai, ribs were very tender and flavorful, the peanut chicken was nothing special. The staff was friendly and the chef was very personable, however, I wouldn't consider going back.

Started off with chicken spring rolls which were presently very well. They were light and crispy and came with a sweet sauce that paired excellently.

I ordered the Gia Katchu. It was a very tasty dish. The sweet sauce with onions and peppers made a good combo. However, the chicken had to be frozen and breaded somewhere else based on the look of them. I was disappointed about that. 

My girlfriend ordered the Holy Basil Chicken. It was a bit spicy for my taste, but she enjoyed it. The chicken was seasoned nicely and was topped with some items I did not recognize.

Overall, great presentation and pricing with this restaurant. We will visit again. Highly recommended for Thai food lovers.

I love Thai food and was pretty disappointed with the food. We went here because it was convenient but I wish we went to more places.

We got the Chicken Curry and Pad Thai. The curry was good but it was for the price, it wasn't worth it; I've had better. 

The Pad Thai was pretty bland. 

I am sure that there are other and better Thai places in Phoenix. I don't know for sure because I was on there for a few days, but I highly suggest going somewhere else.

LOVED this place! I had the beef Penang curry. It was spicy enough the regular way but you can adjust the heat as desired. I had to take home half because the portion was so large; a great deal for around $10! Our server was friendly and attentive and the atmosphere was cozy and clean. Would definitely come here again.

I have loved this place since I first started coming here in 2008. Definitely the best Thai I have had in town and I will travel from the north valley for this  restaurant. Everyone I have taken here loves it. Pad Thai is delicious with chicken and shrimp. Curries are divine. Hubby loves their beef dishes. Soups are amazing. Love the corn fritters appetizer.
