Definitely a treat and different. Have not had a dish here that I did not like. Mango cheesecake is a must. Love this place. The outdoor seating is precious even though smack dab in central phx

We have been here several times, and it has been fantastic every time.

The wait staff always remembers us, and is very friendly. The service is always great.

They keep the place clean as well, and that is a major plus.

The food has always been very, very good. Flavorful, and well priced.

I always order the Merry-Mu, which is a very good pork dish. I have also recently become a fan of the Fillet, as it is better than most steaks I have eaten that were three times the price at other places.

The Coconut sticky rice could be a meal all by itself, it is that good - and I am not a rice fan. Even the garnish/filler food is loaded with flavor.

The Mango Cheesecake is my favorite cheesecake desert of any place I have eaten, it is amazing.

I think this is one of the best places to eat in Phoenix, and it is worth the wait, the drive, and the money.

Stopped by for dinner. 

The sign says please wait to be seated.

So I waited, and waited, and waited some more. 

Employees walking by the hostess station. No greeting, or anything.

So I left and went to Thai Basil.

The food and service were quite good. I had never had white papaya before and could have sworn I was eating jicama and learned a new favorite fruit. They were generous to serve the ice separate from the ice coffee so I could add as little ice as I liked. 
I was disappointed that I couldn't sit on the outdoor patio since the heat index was 104

While Thaiger is my favorite lunch time Thai place. It's super close to my work. The lunch specials are well priced. I can call it in and take out. For the most part they are pretty consistent. From the outside you'd never guess that the inside was actually classy looking. Dimly lit with very dark furniture. Inside has an upscale feel though the outside looks pretty busted.

My two favorite lunch time orders are yellow chicken curry and pad Thai. Followed closely by the beef panang. And while I've had better, the convenience of this place can't be beat. The staff is always friendly on the phone and in person.

Cheers for Thai Fridays!

Best chicken pad thai that I have ever eaten. I ordered it Thai hot and it came as hot as advertised, few places will make it that hot. The meal presents well, accompanied with shredded cabbage and beets.

Went to lunch at the Wild Thaiger yesterday after having no luck ordering to-go a couple weeks ago.  We sat outside on the covered patio, which was pretty busy.  Our server was prompt and pleasant.  

The food: I ordered chicken with peanut sauce and Jasmine rice.  The sauce was very flavorful, but no heat at all.  I'm used to peanut sauce with just a bit of heat and was mildly disappointed with this dish.  My friend ordered the Pad Thai and it was good, but again not much heat.  Now our server did not ask us about stars or heat at all.  If I were to go back I would order the Pad Thai with a side of peanut sauce and add more heat.

All in all, an affordable lunch, good service, and decent Thai food.  I would like to go back in the evening to check out the inside as I never set foot in it.  Maybe try another dish too.

Phoenix Yelpers- any other awesome Thai places to try??

We saw a Guy Fieri endorsement on the door so we figured it was a safe bet. 

We both ordered the chicken Pad Thai with some spring roll appetizers.  Great tasting food. Very large portions. Only issue was was ordered medium spice based on the waitress suggestions and it could have been much hotter. Not really spicy at all. 

We sat inside, but they have a very large outdoor eating area as well. 

4 Bud for $9 was a great deal as well.

The service was great, our waitress was attentive, friendly and new the menu.
The food was everything Guy said it is.....awesome!
The best Thai food I have ever had! I love how they made my pad Thai vegan! Very nice staff as well!! Will be going back very soon!

3/5/10
My second attempt to dine here, as it was so busy the first time (and so noisy!), that I had to leave.  (It was during lunch hours, and I don't like to wait.)  Arrived a few minutes shy of the end of lunch, so I was able to dine in peace.  Ordered the tofu green curry and the fried banana and coconut ice cream for dessert.  I found the portion of the entree to be very skimpy for the price, and I've had much tastier, and creamier, curry sauce elsewhere (Tottie's, Thai Elephant, even Yupha's!).  Need I say more?  Seriously, WT's green curry tastes about the same as Thai Hut's, but at a portion that's about half (or less) of what I could get at TH, or any of the other places I've visited, but I suppose the "atmosphere" is what I'm paying for here?  That said, I must admit that the fried banana dessert was delicious!  Loved the toasted coconut on top (well, on top of the bananas, but under the syrup toppings, coconut ice cream, whipped topping, and maraschino cherry!).  On my next visit, when I'm craving for something sweet, I will ask to have the syrup toppings, whipped cream, and cherry omitted.  The dish is perfect w/out them.

This was my girlfriends first Thai experience and she has been won over!  I owe a bit of thanks to DDD for this as we do like to try the places we see not only on that show, but others.  

We started with what DDD raved about; the Dragon's Egg's were out of the park outstanding!  Just perfect with the slice of jalapeno.  The waitress was spot on with her suggestions and the Peanut Passion was a good place to start for my girlfriend.  I sampled her dish and the peanut sauce was exactly what I expected, not too salty and a bit sweet.  The carrots were a bit off, however.  I had the Phuket Fantasea.  You could season with spice to your own palate which, I was courteous and let my girlfriend have a go before I spiced it up.  

The wait was a bit long, but reading some of the other comments, it's to be expected.  Not to mention, they were fairly busy for a Sunday evening!  All in all, outstanding and next spring training, we will no doubt be making a return!
My boyfriend brought me here for Valentine's day dinner and I honestly feel in love! The curry was perfect not too spicy.

Although I was aware of the ratings beforehand, this place was recommended by staff members at the hotel we were staying at-- as well as Triple D. So what the heck, we gave it a shot.

There was two other parties in the restaurant when we arrived for lunch on a Saturday, and by the time we ordered another 4 parties had arrived.

Right off the bat our waitress seemed impatient and not very friendly, which isn't a good start to anyone's experience. I didn't see anyone else on the floor so she must've been the only one waiting on the tables.

We started off with some veggie and chicken rolls-- which were nothing memorable. My dish was the pad Thai which again, nothing that id recommend or come back for. It lacked in flavor, and had some sort of dry pepper flakes on it which I've never had before whenever ordering this familiar dish. 

The other two dishes that were ordered at my table were decent in flavor but nothing special. 

At least the ice tea was pleasant!

I've come to assume the hype is all from Triple D, otherwise... I just don't get it?

What a great little Thai place in Central Phoenix. Great lunch specials Mon-Fri. (Not as great on the weekends.) I like that that Pad Thai comes with chicken, tofu and shrimp all in one dish for one price. I prefer a bit spicier, maybe I should have asked for that. The plate was piled high with noodles, green onions, peeled beets and carrots. I took a book, sat by myself and had a great afternoon. 

Prompt, friendly service. They kept my water full, that's all I require to leave a great tip. 

Lots of choices on the menu, lots of drink specials. Parking in the back, or take the light rail. This is a great place.

Awful experience. Arrive at 11:55 today. Seated at 12:00. 15 minutes later we had to get up and ask for a drink and for someone to take the order. We never saw a server again. At least not at our table. The people next to us got decent service. It seemed like the new their server. We finally had to leave. When we told the hostess on the way out. It was just, "ok" like that was a normal occur again. Never again.

Tried Wild Thaiger last night. Great spot , had to try it after watching Diners, Drive ins & Dives. Didn't realize where it was & the location is so accessible & right next to Durants.  Started off with the DDD recommended dragon eggs . We tried them half crispy half steamed ... delicious! WE then had the Phad Thai to split and we both liked it . I would describe the ambiance as eclectic & fun . There was a very large office gathering so, the noise level was a little louder due to that, but we will be back. Cute little date spot.

Probably the best chicken pad thai I've ever had. I love thai food! But this is the first place I've experienced the pad thai spicy...and might I say, it is amazing! The house salad was pretty good for a salad. The mango with sticky rice hit the spot...and fulfilled my dessert craving. If I'm ever in town again, I'm definitely coming back here!!
The food is awesome and the decor is great.  I've eaten here a few times and never been disappointed.

I just finished eating at this place I came because off that show, the triple D. Mind you the food was amazing but the service sucks!!!!!!! I think because of the show she is getting more business than usually, my opinion she needs to hire more staff! I came from California just to try her food and I was skipped twice to be seated and then 3 times to be waited on! I had to ask to be waited on! Not ok!

Went out here for a friend's birthday party the other week.  They were wonderful in accommodating the large party of 20 people that we had even though they don't have the largest of space.  The food was wonderful.  Typically, not too spicy for those with heat-wary tongues, but for the true spice nuts, they have dishes that will make your eyes water. The Dragon Eggs and Vegetable and Spring rolls were amazing.  For an entree, I highly recommend the Tropical Fried Rice, Kimow, and Phuket Fantasea.  Service can be slow at times, but the wait is definitely worth it.

Food was excellent, but we were a bit neglected on a slow Saturday night with the service. It might have been no dedicated hostess to greet and more of the attention was on waiting tables outside. There were only three couples inside including us. The food took awhile to come out and wife had sand in her broccoli for her entree. I would come back probably for a lunch instead of dinner to give it another chance.
Love this place!! Great food, sometimes very busy at odd hours(right near closing!) but worth the wait.

I was stuck in Phoenix for the night and needed to find some dinner.  I walked down the street from hotel room and headed towards a highly rated steakhouse.  But, when I saw the prices and weighed my hunger - I thought better about it.  Next door, I found Wild Thaiger which was also highly rated and seemed like a better choice.  I was right!!  I sat down at the bar and was quickly helped by the friendly waitress.  I flipped through the menu and saw all the usual Thai fare - but one specialty stuck out to me...  a spicy wild boar dish.  I was in and the waitress double checked to be sure I was aware about the spiciness of the dish.  Armed with a beer and water, I dove in for a fantastic feast.  I didn't notice the sliced thai chilies that adorned the dish until I really dug in.  Phew!!  It was spicy and it was delicious!!!  The wild boar appeared and tasted like tender slices of pork.  The sauce was flavorful and the chilies gave it a great kick.  The Thai girls in the kitchen were pleasantly surprised to see me finish the plate without suffering too much.  In fact, I LOVED it.  

I don't really spend much time in Phoenix, but I will revisit Wild Thaiger if I am near by.
Always the best service good....don't miss mango cheese cake favorite pad cha seafood....

Im not sure why this place was featured on Diners, Dives and Drive-ins. Its not that great.  The chicken pad thai is pretty decent, but I have had better.  My second trip here was not great at all.  Came in and it wasn't crammed packed like the first time, so that was nice but the service was horrible.  My friend and I sat and waited as we watched the tables clear out one by one and no food came out.  I had to flag the waitress down twice before she would even respond as to why we had been waiting for 1/2 hour at this point for our food. It was a piss poor excuse and they weren't that apologetic.  We finally got our food  45 minutes into my hour lunch and it wasn't as good as the first time.  Pad thai was barely warm enough to eat.  If you want chili paste brought to your table.... an additional .50 cents.  WTF?  There prices are high enough to compensate the making of chili paste dry or wet.  I don't know if I will come back here.  I would rather drive down the road a few miles and go somewhere else.  Sadly.
Great food.  Poor service.  Waitress was rude and avoided my inquire of service. I had to wait 20 minutes to get food.

I am so glad I didn't let the 3.5 stars keep us from coming to Wild Thaiger for dinner. I have never had Thai before and I loved it! We got the hot pot soup first to share because it looked interesting, and oh my goodness it was fantastic. I couldn't get enough. The coconut mixed with the lemon, basil, parsley, spice... YUM! We also got gluten free pad Thai and Mi Dang. Both were amazing. The service was also exceptional. All the servers were so nice and helpful.  I will definitely be back!

My second visit, first on an incredibly busy New Years Day dinner service, and I must say that was a much better experience than this lunch. It was not very busy and the best attention we received was from the sweet beverage server. I attempted to order from her and she needed to get our server, wish we could have kept the first one. Alex seemed put off by us and hardly wanted to engage our questions about the menu after putting in our starter. Took an additional fifteen minutes or more before we requested her return so we could place or entree order. Starter: Dragon eggs, 6 fried dumplings filed with pork and crab, $10, I was so hungry at this point and they were a nice start. They did taste like chicken meat balls though with a sweet hoison. I ordered beef panang and was surprise that there were absolutely no vegetables in my dish, I order curries often. The portion was large and I'll dress up the rest with veggies at home but I will now be returning to Wild Thaiger. The beverage server should move to a nicer place that will recognize her genuine nature and potential talents.
Love this place. Great Thai food and has been one of my favorite spots in Phoenix for years!

I've always been a fan of Wild Thaiger.  It's location is great, right off the light rail on Central in Midtown.  On my quests for eating in some of my favorite places before I leave Phoenix, I met a good friend for dinner here last night. The food was wonderful as always, but one think last night stuck out.  When we arrived, we waited at the hostess station for probable 3 minutes before we were greeted.  Very odd.  Then when we were seated, another 4 minutes later before someone came over to take our drink order. A person who wasn't even our server.  Now when our server did come over, he was very attentive for the rest of the evening and the service was excellent. 

We started with the Freshie Rolls. YUM.  These fresh "Vietnamese type" rolls were so yummy and for sure stand up to their name "fresh".   They came with a wonderful spicy peanut sauce.  I had the Pad Thai.  Thin rice noodles prepared with chicken, shrimp, and tofu topped with fresh sprouts, and crushed peanuts.  As always it was delicious and plentiful.
If you're in the area and want great Thai, give them a try.
Food has gotten so much better. the vegetarian 24K rocks my world with Thai pumpkin, eggplant, veggies in spicy green curry. get it hot!!! delicious. service is fast and friendly too.
Good was great. A little busy but was seated quickly. Def a good place to stop for a date.

Always happy with the food and service. The only HIV infected rodent I saw was the couple who complained about everything.  Im sure we have all sat next to them before!  Nice restaurant, happy its in the neighborhood!
The food was okay. I felt like the dishes we had didn't have enough flavor. Tastes kind of bland. Thai food should be strong with flavor and I didn't get that. However the customer service was great.

I've eaten here a few times now and everything I've had has been fantastic as well as the service. The dragon eggz and the crab wontons are two of my favorite appetizers anywhere. The fried banana with coconut ice cream is friggin yummy. Still workin my way through the entrees but I haven't had a bad one yet!!!

Food is very tasty but the main drawback is, they take so much time to get our order ready. We almost waited like 30 mins to get our food served but apart from that, worth the money you pay. Its a bit expensive but its fine. Will definitely go back.

It was my first time experience here. I ordered chai tea and it was great. Then I ordered tom yam goong. The flavor of fish sauce was quite strong. I tasted salty overcome the tamarind. 
I ordered curry and that one the decent one for my taste. Little bit spicy which is I like. The decor was nice, I felt comfortable. The service was fast and great waiter. There is a board sign for cellphone user ..lol...
They have Indonesian coffee which I should try next time. 
The private parking lot was in the back of the building.
I might go back to try something else next time.

I actually like this place. I find the mood to be nice and the lighting just right. The food is well prepared and the alcoholic drinks are fantastic. Martinis! My one complaint....they need to add some more vegetarian dishes.  I find myself ordering this great appetizer every time I go there because it's the only thing with tofu on it. Anyways, it's a great place for a date :)

We enjoyed the food at this restaurant. Our disappointment is in how the wait staff was directed to assist the customer. It seems that the wait staff have a variety of jobs other than taking care of the patron. This caused our food to be delayed. It also caused our bill to be delayed. We never were quite sure who our waitress was. It is some of the best Thai food we've had but the service is disappointing.

Pretty good thai food. I have been here twice and enjoyed the curry dishes very much. Great quality food and perfectly prepared. Service is always prompt and friendly - great place for lunch and dinner.

Great Thai food!  The grapao gai is my favorite, the green curry is great too, as well as the soups. The downsides are that there is usually a wait to be seated and the service is a little slow (for lunch).

Sat outside on a midweek evening.  Very nice atmosphere and outdoor space even though it's on the road, it's done well.  Only two or three occupied tables, but attentive service.  Very good bar drinks.

Food was ok, but perhaps New York City Thai food has us spoiled.  We ordered Dragon Eggz dumplings, not outstanding.  Pad See Ew and Peanut Passion was fine, not extraordinary.

I would try other area restaurants before returning here, but would not be opposed to returning especially for the service and atmosphere.

Came here with a few friends. Food is decent, except one of my friends got a soup that didn't taste right (might have given her the wrong order?). Although I'd like to give this place another shot, the service will definitely be keeping me away. It wasn't busy at all, but our server was not very attentive. Maybe if I'm desperate for Thai when I'm downtown, I'll give it another shot.

I've been there about 5 times and all those times have been horrible. I shouldn't have to wait about 5 minutes to get their attention on a drink to go. All I wanted was a Thai tea. When I actually sat down and ate, the service took awhile before they got to me too. Food was good, but I've had better. This place needs to either hire more people or organize themselves better.

I love everything about this place (except the location because it's too far from me). I've eaten at many Thai restaurants but Im yet to find one that is better than Wild Thaiger. The food is fabulous, packed with flavor and a very hearty portion.

Almost every time I have come in this place, they have been so busy. Their food speaks for itself. Having to eat gluten free their pad Thai and gf chicken curry, I am never sick after eating here and always am full. They have perfect sharing portions for much of their foods and I hope you'll give them a shot. I will be back and may see you there sometime!

Well...mixed bag!

Went with a buddy on a Wednesday night and the place seemed to be hopping...maybe a bit too busy as the service was pretty bad.  We were seated right away, but waited 15 minutes for a waiter.  Appetizer arrived fairly promptly, but there was nearly a 30 minute wait after the appetizer was cleared for main courses to arrive.  

We had the Vegie Sampler as an appetizer and it was incredibly delicious - I'd go back just to order that dish!  Crispy/crunchy corn fritters, big chunks of seared tofu (which sounds sort of nasty to a meat-eater like me but was incredible!) with peanut sauce, and crispy fried vegie rolls.  This dish was the only real winner - and was way over the top with flavor!

My buddy had a tofu/vegie dish - I wish I knew what it was exactly - but on the menu it had a single pepper on it.  He ate half of it and was beading with sweat, so beware that even a "medium heat" dish can get pretty hot.  I asked for a vegie/chicken dish - something "healthy" and was told about a dish with a soy and garlic sauce.  The chicken and vegies were fairly good (a bit heavy on the cauliflower maybe) but the sauce just tasted "off" - not like soy/garlic at all and was odd enough that I didn't finish the dish either.  It wasn't flavorful - it didn't taste like I'd had it described - and it didn't compliment the rest of the dish.   Both of our issues with main courses are probably more personal preferences but there's also room for improvement maybe in how the dishes were described to us.

I had a ginger martini and my buddy had a very tall mai tai ($6 - which was a good deal for the large glas!).

So...hit and miss...but I will try it again.

I recently discovered that I am gluten intolerant. What distressed me most was the thought of not having savory, delicious Thai food again. After a quick Yelp search I found Wild Thaiger who has a decent vegetarian and gluten free menu. 

I ordered the yellow curry with tofu, veggies and brown rice. OMG!!!! It was sooooo good. It cost extra to substitute white rice with brown. Not sure why it's an extra cost but whatever. I ordered it from the list of lunch specials. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because their lack of vegetarian soup options. The lunch specials include soup and egg roll. Well, there should be a non meat based soup for your vegan and vegetarian customers. That being said, I will most certainly return and get the exact same meal!!

The Wild Thaiger is the best kept Thai restaurant secret on North Central Avenue.  My first culinary experience at Thaiger was several months ago with co-workers. My omnipresent dinner companion Marcial and I, have been habitual customers since.

Office employees flock to Wild Thaiger during the week for lunch and bring a few close friends or relatives back at night or on the weekend to share their secret.  The restaurant atmosphere is very friendly and unpretentious.  

The food is where the adventure begins. For a flaming start, Tom Yum Goong is a must of any visit to Wild Thaiger.  The soup is a concert of spicy hot lemony flavors that leave you wanting more.  Don't fret, you can always order more to go.
Dragon's Eggs are paramount on our list of favorite's starters These Dumplings are stuffed with pork and crab, wrapped in tender wrapping, nestled in fresh vegetables and comes with a seasoned dipping sauce. 

The Lunch and dinner menu is delectable and you will want to try a new dish on each visit.

Order hint: Each plate is made to your specification.  If you want "more curry", "spicier" or "hotter" you only need to ask. 

Desert Hint: The Coconut Ice Cream is made onsite: It is delicious and contagious.

Drink hints: A nice compliment to the food is a glass of Chardonnay or you can try the sweet Thai Iced Tea. 

It is very common for the Olashawn (owner and head chief) to leave the open kitchen to seat, greet, and serve her guests.  She is the heart of The Wild Thaiger.  As Marcial and I leave and thank her for another wonderful meal, her gracious smile, hands clasps and graceful bow, keeps us coming back.

Note:  METRO Lightrail construction has impacted this restaurant and you need to follow construction signs carefully to navigate the street and driveway to Wild Thaiger.  Drive slow, this Tiger is worth hunting in the concrete jungle.
Atmosphere is good. Food is alright. Staff could be more attentive. Prices are a bit high.
Pretty nice setting, nice waitresses, *really* good food, and the price is right. I easily could have expected lunch to cost twice as much; $8 for a Chicken Curry plate for lunch, I'm sold.

As Thai food goes it was solid. I took my family for a night out service was quick the food was good. I was a little bummed that they ran out of ribs. But the Beef Panang I had was on point. I would go back for sure.

Called in another order earlier this week. It was ready when I got there. As always, the food was amazing. I'm still trying to figure out how they have beef of such incredible quality. They cook it perfectly. Just awesome. One nitpick- dinner costs more than lunch but you don't get a spring roll with it? Come onnnnn! Just throw one in the bag. I won't tell!

Had lunch here today with a friend. Decent sized patio. Ate inside. Decor was nice. 

Tom Yum soup was ok. 2.5/5. Didn't have the depth of flavor that I was hoping for. 

Tofu Panang, on the other hand, was fantastic. 5/5. Bold and well-balanced flavors. Great heat to it. 

Service wasn't friendly. She seemed rushed and bothered. But she was very efficient, so that was cool at least.
This is my go to place near work for some Pad Thai.  I am a huge fan of their Veggie Pad Thai or their Pad Thai in general.  Always a fan when craving Thai.  Their Thai Ice Tea is also delish!

I've been on a big-time Thai curry kick lately. For the past couple months, I've gone on a food crusade to find the best curry in Phoenix. The big winner (drum roll...): Wild Thaiger. I had the yellow curry with vegetables and tofu from the lunch menu. The tofu and vegetables were perfectly cooked and the curry base was full of flavor. It says a lot that Wild Thaiger was one of the first Thai places I tried during my journey, and it managed to stay at the top of my list throughout. Next time you're in the central Phoenix area and in need of a curry fix, give this place a try.

I LalaLOVE this place!! I've been on this crazy Thai kick for a long while now and after trying so many places that were decent but not too amazing, I found this place! THIS IS MY THAI SPOT now! 

My friend and I decided to go here for lunch and it was pretty busy. But we were seated quickly and ready to order. We got the spring rolls (1 came with the lunch menu item) which were so delicious and crispy. For our entrees, we got the pad thai and the red curry. Both dishes were amazing. But the pad thai was our favorite, which is a big deal to us since I don't really like pad thai that much. The curry was a little spicy but it was so creamy and flavorful. The veggies were perfectly cooked and the tofu wasn't soggy. The pad thai was loaded with veggies and again the tofu was not soggy. It was such a great dish. 

Service was good. Our waitress was sweet and prompt. 
The food is inexpensive for the quality.

We can't wait to come back. 

Oh and I love the name of this place. "The wild THAIger." Rawr! So clever.
Food was good but soup wasn't hot.  Service was incredibly slow even though no one was in the restaurant but a couple other two tops.  I'd come back but try a different server next time.

I came here on a yelp review for the area and really didn't know what to expect since a lot of people mentioned long waits.  I came on a Sunday at 3 pm and had the whole place to myself. Sat inside waitress's super nice and gave me some food tips I ended up ordering yellow curry chicken and thai iced tea I missed the lunch menu ended at 2 but all in all food was good curry was a little thicker than usual but meat was tender and veggies perfect. Entree was around $10 and tea $3 I also ordered basil chicken as suggested for my lunch tomorrow (beats airplane food) I walked from downtown Phoenix close to ASU about 2 mile walk but yes I would come again when in Phoenix!
Sweet and sour soup was yummy. But the pad Thai was disgusting. The curry did not have enough sauce.
Excellent Thai food! A must-visit place form those who love Asian food. Food is superb. Service is excellent, and the prices are VERY reasonable. Hope they open more locations in the valley!

We were craving Thai food and we saw that this place was on Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives so we were excited to give it a try. It was a busy Thursday night dinner and the floor was extremely understaffed -- the hostesses were cleaning/rearranging tables and delivering check to customers in between seating people. Granted, the place is small, but there were only two other actual servers taking orders and running the entire floor. This was just the beginning of a sadly disappointing night here.

We ordered the fresh rolls for an appetizer, chicken pad Thai and the Thaiger Ribs with Thai tea. The fresh rolls came out quickly and while I thought it was a generous serving size for an appetizer and for the price, the fresh rolls were bland. The side sauce that came with it was overdone and was outside the traditional peanut sauce that usually comes with it. The rest of our food came 25 mins after our appetizer came out, which we thought was a little long but we waited patiently anyway. This pad Thai was very much forgettable -- in fact, it lacked flavor. It came in a huge, beautifully presented plate but there was nothing more to it. The Thaiger ribs were overdone to the point that the meat was tough and hard to chew. Again, the side sauce that came with it was unfitting and did not complement the BBQ sauce of the ribs.

We didn't finish our meals and were very disappointed. We had to get the staff's attention so we could get our checks and leave, which still added another 10-15 mins. The only reason I'm not giving this place a one star is because the few staff that we encountered on the floor were great even if they were under extreme stress. I probably would not come back here again.

We started with the jasmine iced tea.  Very refreshing and I didn't even add sugar to it.  A couple starters. Lab Gal and Dragon Eggz. The Eggz were amazing. Keep in mind all the food brought to our table was presented as you would see in magazines. Works of art on plates. I ordered a Papua salad. Whoooweee spicey just like I like it. I had the chicken and yellow curry. Gawd it was sooo good. My fianc opted for the wild boar dish. BC we were pretty sure they were true to the 3 pepper heat index he asked if they'd do a not so spicey version. he was thrilled with his plate. He said my 1 pepper index salad was spicier.... Portions are large and I felt that prices were more than fair. Seating on the inside is limited and very classy. We showed up around 630ish on Friday (night before Valentine's Day) and the place quickly filled up after that. Outside seating looked like a lot of fun and they have heaters out there too. If given a choice, I would have chosen out there. Although not a black tie place, people were dressed from way below casual to dresses. Service took a little bit, but very well worth the wait. The staff were very nice and informative. When we come back next year, we will be having dinner here again.
I just experienced the best Pad Thai of my life! The Wild Thaiger has a relaxed atmosphere, is a great place to go out with friends, and the prices are awesome!
Great food and generally good service. Lunch time can turn into a loong wait, but it's always worth it. Green Curry, mmmmmmmmmmm!

Good Thai food is hard to find.

You've found it here!

I went here for lunch today and was blown away. I feel like I've been to so many places around the valley and just haven't found one that I like. I found this place on a whim and decided to try it out. I'm vegan so it's hard for me to find places where I can eat anything. This place had multiple options and everything I tasted was good. I had the Tofu Veggie Pansang. It was delightfully spicy and the tofu was cooked perfectly. My friend had the pad thai and was equally as impressed.

They had good lunch specials and delicious Iced Tea.

I will be going back here again.
I really enjoyed the food here. The Ribs were amazing, they fell right off the bone and the sauce was very flavorful! Everyone in our party enjoyed their food! Great experience.

When it comes to Thai food I have definitely had my share of experiences. The only experience I have yet to experience is actually eating in Thailand. I've had Thai food around many places in the U.S. Such San Francisco, San Diego, Los Angeles, Phoenix, Chicago. I also had Thai in China. 

That being said eating here tonight has By far reached and exceeds beyond my expectation. I was joined with my friend who is Laos. Laos being neighbors of Thailand, the food is just about the same with of slight differences. After a 20min wait on First Friday, we waited another 15-20 mins per each dish. We ordered 3. The first dish was spring rolls. Let me tell you I have had my share of spring rolls with peanut sauce. I thought I would experience just any other experience I've had, which is average. I mean it's spring rolls. The first bite with the peanut sauce was the most delicious bite I have ever had. I could of just ordered spring rolls and I would of been more than satisfied. My friend mentioned that the sauce was authentic sauce it was not your typical restaurant sauce. My friend felt like a she tasted a piece of home.
We found our local Thai! Have only picked up orders to go, but the food is delicious and the service is great. The restaurant is really cute with a great outdoor area.

I order take out from here fairly regularly, they're always prompt and delicious. The coconut curry and the pad see ewe are awesome. I'm not sure if they have lunch specials so it can be a bit more expensive for a quick lunch but the quality is evident and totally worth the extra two or three dollars you spend instead of going somewhere not nearly as good. You can tell their meats are quality and not just hidden under a load of spices. Highly recommended.
Food wasn't bad, just wish their thai hot was actually hot. Excuse the criticism but this thai restaurant is definitely watered down in terms of authenticity.

I had the yellow curry chicken for lunch.  Excellent curry flavor, just the right size for a mildly spiced lunch.  The dish is curry with chicken and potatoes in the broth and large helping of rice in the middle.  I would definitely order the dish again.

Holy grail of Thai food in Phoenix. Guy Fieri approved. Get ready to take a ride to Flavortown.

They are a little on the slow side but it's nothing to lessen the 5 star rating or prevent me from ever coming back. The waiters are always extremely nice which makes up for it too. 

I always get the yellow curry with tofu and veggies and it's just to die for. It's creamy, rich, and plated beautifully. We always order 2 of the Satay Sampler, one with the works and one with only chicken. I personally think the works is the best way to go. The chicken, beef, and shrimp all pair perfectly with the peanut sauce, I can't even decide which meat is best. We also ordered a Tom Ka Gai to share and it was A+++. Lastly, we ordered a Milk Tea. I'm a sucker for boba and their boba was good. Good not great. The milk tea tasted like cereal milk, which was strange, but not unappetizing.
Of course I had to try this Gem in downtown Phoenix because it was on triple DDD. Let's just say I will be back for the dragon eggs they were so good!!!! The Padtai was some of the best I've had.
Best Thai Restaurant in AZ.  And I include in that statement the entire experience.  Great food, nice unique wine list, interesting cocktails.  Panang and Urban Riesling done and done.

So, this place was my absolute favorite Thai restaurant in Phoenix until today. The service was pretty slow for only having me, my friend, and another costumer in the restaurant. The food was cold when is was brought out to us -with no radishes like they usually put on them, and those make the dish!- My friend ordered medium hot, and she got no spice. She didn't even eat it! Plus the spring roll I ordered wasn't the usual one they serve, it was small and gross AND my friend didn't even get the sticky rice she ordered, the waitress still tried to charge us for it. Needless to say, they have let me down :(

Great place for lunch. The berry green tea is excellent and their lunch specials are very reasonable. I had something with eggplant and beef in it and my wife had the ginger chicken. Fast service and great prices for the quality of food you get!

Been wanting to try this place for awhile ever since I saw it on diner,drive in and dives.. they have couple of ur usual menu items u will find in any other Thai restaurants like pad Thai, different types of curry and etc.. my friend and I ordered the "dragon eggs" which are dumplings u can either have it steamed or crispy or half and half.. and the chicken egg rolls .. then I ordered the spicy boat dish which was pretty good.. never seen it anywhere else and my friend ordered a chicken dish.. we both enjoyed our meals.. this place is small, I suggest coming early before any lunch or dinner rush because it does get crowded pretty fast.. they have their own private parking lot in the back..
Bland and uninspired. The girls don't know the menu items and ingredients. I've lived in Thailand and street food there is better.
Good food and service. If the food is listed as spicy it is. Papaya salad was excellent as was the jasmine tea. Service was perfect.

I was excited to try this place in a fun area of town.  Unfortunately, the service was slow and the food was low quality for the price.  Fish was overcooked and dumplings mediocre.  Not a place I would go back to since there are so many good options out there.

One night we decided to look for a good thai restaurant in CenPho, and upon some searching and previous good reviews, we chose to try the Wild Thaiger. We started the meal off with the corn fritters. They were crispy and delicious and had a yummy cucumber chutney with them. For my entree, I had the Tofu Mangone and it was awesome. I love spice, and not just a little, I like a lot, and my dish certainly turned up the heat. We finished the meal with the blueberry kaffir lime cheesecake. It was creamy, cool, and a wonderful way to end a meal. I'm so happy to have found a good thai place!
Definitely worth a visit.  Good food and good service.  The dumpling and corn fritter apppetizers were fantastic.  As well as the fried rice.  I've had better pad thai before but it was still good!

My sister and I met here for a pre-game dinner before the Diamondbacks game.  I arrived before she did, so I sat in one of the couches on the patio.  I was approached a couple of times by waitresses during this time, but told them I was just waiting for someone.  When my sister arrived, we went to the hostess stand to request a table.  There was one couple ahead of us, then two or three other couples arrived and crowded the hostess stand as we waited for someone... ANYONE... to seat us.  There is a tall room divider that separates the hostess area from the service area/bar/kitchen, so nobody knew we were there.  This should probably be addressed to avoid a crowd in an already small waiting area.  Once we were seated, our waitress took great care of us, and was happy to suggest drinks and food items.  We ordered the Dragon Eggz (prepared both steamed and fried), the Satay Sampler, and the Lahb Gai.  We loved the first two items, but the third wasn't exactly our piece of cake, although it was prepared nicely.  Using cabbage in the capacity of a lettuce roll was a little awkward.  All in all, we were both very pleased with our meal.  Had we not already been full (and in a rush) we would have ordered the coconut ice cream, which other Yelpers seem to sing the praises of.  I will definitely come back here.

Busy at lunch, but this place is awesome.  Great selection but could do better on the service and speed during lunch hour. 

Dragon Eggs for appetizer was good. 
I had the catfish with a 1 pepper spice level and it was awesome.
Sister said it was the best fried rice she's had in a long time. 

Check it out but go on off hours.

The food was ok, service slow even though it wasn't crowded when we first got there - it did however get very busy 30 mins after, around noon.
The only thing I really liked about this place was the unsweetened iced green tea. 
I got the chicken pad Thai which was ok - decent price at $8.95 but if you want a spring roll it's another $1.50, and soup another $1.50. The soup of the day was egg drop soup and it was really gross - bad after taste like dirt, so didn't end up eating it. 
I know it's a lunch rush but the wait staff wasn't attentive and took the food so long to come out, especially comparing it to other Thai places in the area. 
I doubt I'll come back.

Nice restaurant, good service but food was okay.

I'm not a huge Thai fan and am not an expert by any stretch. I have a few favorites and prefer flavor over spice/heat. The two dishes I had at Wild Thaiger were lacking in flavor. They had awesome aromas, but fell flat on the palate. The chicken in both dishes was rubbery and overcooked.

However, this was a cute restaurant and the service was good. The patio was nice.
This was my first time eating here. I came for a celebratory dinner. The service was very poor, our food came out in different order. It was over priced and came out cold for the amount food you get.

The Wild Thaiger is one of my new favorite places.  Every dish I've tried as been excellent.  They accomodated with some grace a friend with food allergies and were polite -- too polite -- in serving me as I (unknowingly) arrived just at closing.  The peanut sauce on the satay is amazing.  Pad Thai is a standby at a Thai place, but it definitely does not disappoint here.  The beef curry was excellent.  The ginger fish dish less remarkable but still good.  Coconut ice cream dessert is good for putting out the fire.  Good place to go after an Art or Heard museum visit.

Delicious. Came here for lunch instead of going to our usual Thai Basil. The only complaint I have is that the food took forever. I went around 11 am with my coworker and it seemed like another family that came in 15 minutes after us got their food before we did. The food was good, but I wish the egg roll wasn't extra.

Usually when my friends go on and on about how they love a restaurant, I can't wait to get in and try the food. Our tastes are often a match. 

The first concern I had from the beginning was the fact that there was only one person of Thai descent working and she was slinging the stuff they were selling. 

We open the menu to find reasonably priced fare (a soft spot for my wallet). Many of the dishes you would be accustomed to finding in any Thai restaurant could also be found on the menu here. Since it was my first visit to this establishment, I decided to go safe and ordered the Pad See Iew with Chicken. Once it arrived, I was pleased with the presentation. But in my many years of eating I have learned, just because it look good fo show don't mean it goin' da taste good!! To be fair it wasn't horrible... but I certainly have had better. 

The waitress could have been quite a bit more attentive. Something just seemed a little off about her? I couldn't quite put my finger on what it was that was off... but if I do, I'll let you know. Perhaps one thing could have been the fact that a table of 8 came into her section about 15 minutes after we arrived and we seemed to have been just forgotten. 

To sum it up folks... if you are in the area and you want a REAL Thai dish with plenty of kick hit up Thai Hut on McDowell and 1st St. Amazing food served by the people that invented the stuff, and prompt extremely attentive service.
Great food , i ordered To go and was told 20 min , waited about 25 . Food was GREAT!! Nice restaurant , set up was nice . I definitely will be coming back to eat here!!

We went back here this past Saturday night with a friend from out of town and liked it just as much as we did when we tried it a few months ago. My Cosmopolitan was just as big and tasty as it was last time, and the service was still attentive and friendly. My friend is a pescetarian/flexitarian (doesn't eat meat except for fish), and we were really pleased to find that all of the dishes we ordered that we usually get with meat were still absolutely delicious. Specifically, the Pad See Ew (which we usually get with chicken or beef) was still savory with just the fried tofu and perhaps even more amazing, the Mussaman curry (which usually comes with a deliciously braised beef) was still really flavorful and was complimented nicely by the tofu. Even after trying a decent number of other Thai places in Phoenix, we like Wild Thaiger for the full bar, consistently good flavors, great service, and fun atmosphere, and we will definitely continue to come here often.

We went in just before the lunch rush. We sat down and our drink orders were taken. It took another 15 minutes for our food order to be taken. I will say that in that 15 minutes the lunch rush came in, so we understood. However, there was not apology or acknowledgment of our extended wait. We saw several of the parties that came in after us served before we received our food. About 25 minutes after our order was taken we received our food. Just as we saw two parties who came in after us headed out the door.  We were finally asked how the food was by an employee (not our waitress) and after telling him about our experience. We were told the full kitchen staff was working, but the wait staff was short. He said he did not know why it took so long for us to be served.  Our main problem was the lack  of apology or acknowledgment.  I really wish I had a pen so I could tell them that the two dollar tip that was left was not an indicator of how cheap I was, but how bad the service was. 

As for the food, i was good, but not amazing. It definitely was not good enough for me to forgive the faults and try this place again.
Worse service i ever had, got a hangover between drinks because it took so long, food was ok, but they have to get yheir shit together or they'll be gone!

The food is good but the service was so rude. I work in the industry so I have never written a bad review before. I tried to call in a Togo order and apparently when busy they do not tend to the phone ... ok I get dine in customers should be a priority. However if I make the effort to drive down to place an order I should be at least get acknowledge. I placed a Togo order and then sat down to wait... I was never offered a drink and when I asked if I could get a cocktail while I wanted I was ignored by the first waitress. The second asked if I need a menu for a drink... I said no I know what I would like ... she walk off.  Then the hostess came over and asked if I wanted a drink... we r going on 10 minutes now... I said I would have love to have a drink but now I'm sure my food will be ready any minute.. hostess was apologetic.. however when I tried to ask for a manager apparently she did not know who that was. Spoke to the waitress with the blue hair one more time to ask a question regarding Togo orders in the future... and explained that I would have liked to have a drink while I had waited ... and apparently she was to busy to to be bothered and told me as much ...  I am so sorry I inconvenienced this establishment and tried spend my money there.

I was at your grand opening, I was there after, and I'm not there anymore. 

Wild Thaiger was never a great option for Thai in the valley. There aren't really any terrible aspects about the restaurant, it's just that nothing really makes you say "wow! this is good."

My last visit was with a friend who doesn't get out much, his wife likes good ol' steak and potatoes, so I thought I'd take him somewhere he couldn't go otherwise. Bad choice. We ordered the peanut chicken and it tasted more like peanut butter chicken. It was overpowering, and also one of the first times I have ever sent a dish back and asked for something else. Of course the service is good, they never have anything better to do.

Spring rolls and chicken pad Thai were absolutely amazing. The spring rolls were super fresh and the flavor profile was quite complex.Discovered this place from watching Diners, Drive one and Dives, and we were not disappointed. Highly recommend

If you can get past the goofy name, the food is pleasing in every way. How the staff behind the line can pump out delicious dishes like the best pad thai I've ever had, present each plate in something resembling high art, and not explode despite a fast-food pace is beyond my meager understanding. It's an Eastern thing, dude.

Also amazing: The female wait staff. Just go. You'll see what I mean. Yeah. Incredible.

Anyway, a good place to remember on North Central.

I've been there twice for lunch during the week.  Food was very good both times.  One of the times, I went they took a long time to bring us the check.  Otherwise, it was very good and I intend on going there more regularly.

Had lunch here last year, I was presently surprised! The building is unique, the location sublime, and the cuisine is way above average. I am big on the yellow chicken curry - Yum!

Had dinner here recently, I was somewhat surprised that it was not the same tremendous experience I had remembered at lunch so long ago. Perhaps they are slipping, or more likely I am :)

This is absolutely The best Thai restaurant anywhere!  I have had  these culinary  masterpieces since they first opened and can never get tired of all the  delicious  flavors  each dish has. From the  appetizers  ( Dragon Eggs) to the specialty dishes ( Pineapple Prawns) to the unbelievable desserts ( Lemon Ginger Cheasecake)  You  could NOT be disappointed ! Ola takes great pride in all her creations and  is usually always there  right along side  her gifted  team.  I could not end this review  without  giving  kudos to the talented wait staff  who are all  great but  I gotta give a special shout out to M & A  !

I was really looking forward to trying this place out and left feeling very disappointed. I had the Pad Se-Eiw which was very bland. I had to drench it in soy sauce and seasoning for it to have any flavor. My friend has the Kimow and said he liked it, but not spicy as listed. I would say go ahead and skip this place as there are many better Thai restaurants in the Valley.
I've been going here for two years. The service is always pleasant and the food is consistently good!

This is about my 1st time here:

PROS:
-Delicious Pad Thai & Panang Curry.
-They have indoor & outdoor seating.
-One of the male servers was very friendly & refilled our waters constantly.

CONS:
-Menu is kind of confusing.
-When it got busier later in the night, it took a long time for my table to get our split checks.
-Their drinks are expensive.
-This Thai restaurant is on the more pricier side.
-It's small inside. The American parties like to talk very loud.

Really, really yummy Thai food. And good service. All five of us selected different meals and every single one was a hit. My only suggestion would have been for maybe a cup of ice cream for the birthday girl. But, overall, a really fine experience. Not a five star location or venue, but really, ya gotta rate the food and service. Nicely done! It's the AYE of the Thaiger!

I've been here several times, but have to admit it gets rougher each time.  First off just be prepared to wait at lunch or get there a bit early, I don't fault them for that, it comes with the location.  The service though, rush or not, has gotten progressively worse each time.  Food is quite good, and I have not had any issues with how spicy, or not, the dishes I have tried here have been.  I used to consider this a front runner in this part of town for Thai, but I think it is more on par with Hut and Elephant now.
Long wait but nice vibe.  Bartender was friendly and helpful.  Food presentation was superb but lacked in flavor.

Seriously the BEST Pad Thai I have ever had!  It was so fresh and had awesome veggies in it! I even tried my sons Curry and the chicken fried rice! Impressive! 
I can not wait to to go back! I was bummed it took so long but then I realized it was worth the wait!
Visiting Phoenix.  Had a Thai food craving.  What a gem this was to find!  Great food!  Lovely setting.

A popular Thai restaurant conveniently located in downtown Phoenix. Crowded at lunch, but the service was still quite good. The food is okay, nothing spectacular but nothing to send back either. We ate on the patio and enjoyed the misters. Inside it was too crowded and noisy for us. This is the kind of place to which I would return if somebody wished us to go there, but I don't think I'd even suggest it as our destination.

The Thai food here is relatively Americanized, but hey, it tastes great regardless. The portions are large and they offer a wide variety of dishes. One unique feature to Wild Thaiger is that in addition to being a Thai restaurant, it's a Thai bar as well. They offer many Asian beers and Indochina-themed cocktails. They have seating indoors and out with a patio view of Central Avenue. The restaurant can be a bit easy to miss, especially for those used to Phoenix' usual parking-in-front cityscape, as it is in an older part of the city with the parking lot through an alley, behind the building. The food is delicious and the drinks are really good.

"Thai" offers so many great pun opportunities for naming a restaurant, and it's great to see an establishment take advantage of it. Wild Thaiger is a top 5 use of "Thai" in a pun for a restaurant.

Other contenders:

"Thaired Elephant" - for a slow paced dining experience that you will remember
"Thai-Died" - for a restaurant inherited by hippies
"My Thaip of Food" - to cast a wide net
"Thair Cuts" - to draw in confused people who want to get their hair cut but might buy Thai food if you get them in the restaurant

"Wild Thaiger" is a pretty good name for this place though. It serves Thai food, which is pretty important for a restaurant to do if it's going to have "Thai" in its name. No feral waitresses or staff appeared during our visit, which led me to believe the "Wild" element is probably just stylistic.

So 5 stars.

Good for: people who appreciate puns in restaurant names.
Bad for: people who want to see wild animals. I would recommend a zoo for that.

This place was highly recommended to us. So we thought we would give it a try..

I ordered the vegetable hot pot, which was a big portion it was steaming in a pot with a flame. It stayed lit the whole time and kept the soup nice and hot..

Other places the flame goes out and the soup ends up being cold.

We would come here more often, but we are not on that side of town much.

If you love Thai food, give this place a try!
Terrible service! Waited 40 min for a cold dinner. Poor table service! Will not return! Get some good help and great servers like Switch!! Read your Yelp reviews!

I'm kind of biased as I love their peanut chicken and have for years. I haven't tried much else from their menu except the soup (which was also d'lish). My girlfriend tells me that their curry chicken is among the best she has ever had. I'll take her word for it as I hate curry.

A great little gem downtown for tasty Thai food..I love the Beef Panang and they used to have these wonderful "Freshie Rolls" that I would think about on a daily basis, but they took them away!! Plllease bring them back! I also love the coconut ice cream. 

Service can be a little spotty and that is my only trouble with this great family owned restaurant.

Since enjoying authentic Thai food in Bangkok and particularly at the Oriental Hotel 20 years ago, I have waited for the day that a Thai restaurant somewhere else approached the delicate blend of flavors of those first tastes. It happened at Wild Thaiger. The soup and the curry were wild and wonderful, and this weekend we were dismayed to find out that we couldn't get take-out before 5pm, but we will be back soon. Big portions. Highly recommended!

The tom kra gai was delicious but I really wasn't very impressed with the basil chicken dish mainly because the chicken was so dry. I ordered thai hot for both and they just put the chilis on top of the chicken so it wasn't spicy.. Like at all. The service was really fast even though we sat outside during lunch rush and she was so friendly!!!

My friends were wanting Thai food and I suggested we go to Wild Thaiger, since it's so good. So we walk in, it's not very busy. Several open tables. The hostess says to wait and runs into the kitchen to talk to a woman putting take out food into bags, she slowly comes back and says "we're understaffed and it will be about 10min before a waiter can get to us". I said that's fine, and asked can we just go sit at the empty table of four then and we'll wait. She looked at me like I said something foreign and refused and said no. I said we can't be seated at the empty table for our party? At this point I'm getting mad and say to her I don't understand why you're refusing to seat us and can wait but you want us to stand in front of the hostess desk. I said never mind, we're leaving, never have been refused to be seated before. She didn't answer, gave me a dirty look and we walked out. I've never experienced anything like that. It's not my fault your understaffed on a weekend, you could have easily seated us with no problem. Absolute horrendous customer service. I've been to your place many times and will not be returning after that.

There is nothing here, not the food, not the service, not the "ambiance", that's worth the inexplicable and inexcusable wait for food to be delivered when the place is half empty to begin with.  I'm done.

This is my go-to Thai place. I love the food here. Usually, my husband and I split the Tom-Ka-Jah (I think thats how its spelled), aka, the coconut soup. Very, very delicious. We have had Thai food all over Phoenix, and this is definitely one of the best. We also really enjoy the Pad Woon Sen, which is the clear noodle dish. Very, very tasty.

Great delicious food with good service here. The only thing is that if you are here and they are busy it might take you awhile to get fed. The kitchen is small...... Drinks are awesome and reasonably priced.

UPDATE 5/19/2008

Finally. Me and the Thaiger are purring like happy kittens. I've discovered their yellow curry at lunch and it is dee lish! Prices are insanely low, tho the lunch menu is limited. Service is upbeat and more polished. Now, a purrrrfect place for me to lunch!!! Hello Kitty!!!!

I think Hello Kitty is wildier than this cat. 
Veggie tempura. I've had crispier wafers from a priest. 

Pad Thai. Wouldn't say it was bad, but, hmmm, what's the word I'm thinking of, oh, I know BLAND! I've had tastier wafers from a priest. 

I love the chef. Very approachable and like, totally, super nice.

 Wait staff, on the two occasions I've been there, were a little inactive. I've had more action from a priest. 

I'll go again. Try new things. But only after I do the Rosary.

Good place but not the best I've had. I'm going to list what we ate in the order of our favorites, Lahb, freshie rolls, papaya salad and dragon eggz. The lahb was really good and I never had it with mint leaves (i'm stealing that btw). I wish they served it with lettuce instead of cabbage, should have asked. The freshie rolls and papaya salad were what I expected and tasted good. 
We were actually disappointed with the dragon eggz. If there was shrimp and crab in there I would have never known. Just tasted like a pork meatball in a wrapper. It was really dense too like they mixed it and shaped it too much. 
Service was excellent and the place was clean and looked nice. If I were in the area and wanted Thai food I would go back, but I wouldn't go out of my way, and I wouldn't go just for the dragon eggz.

I'll admit to occasional skepticism of DDD featured restaurants, but I've dined here pre and post DDD, so its not a factor in this review. In fact, I'd much rather drop into the Wild Thaiger (love the name) than its more illustrious and aging neighbor Durant's. 

We sampled a couple of soups and peanut chicken on our latest visit and, as usual, loved all the selections. We arrived for dinner a bit early on a weeknight and had no wait. Service was prompt and courteous. Menu pricing is reasonable for the quality and location. The kitchen is open concept (sorry, I'm mixing up DDD with Home Hunters) and visible to the curious if you like seeing your food prepared. And the dcor is part tiger, part Thai. 

There are a lot of excellent Thai spots in the Valley, making it a very competitive category in which to earn a five star review. Wild Thaiger is very close. It's also just a bit different from the norm. We always do soup at the Thaiger, not our norm. If you have a passion for Thai cuisine, definitely give Wild Thaiger a try. I wish it was located a bit closer to where I live so that I could more easily frequent it and ponder an upgrade to five stars.

I've been here about a dozen times now and I have never written a review.... but I could write a super review for each of those times.  Tonight I was on my own so I got galee gai and sticky rice to go.  The galee gai is a spicy yellow curry - similar to masaman curry but spicier.  Now, I am a total wimp and this is always spicier than I really can handle but it is so good I deal with it!  I put it on rice and drink a lot of tea :-)  The sticky rice is coconut sweet and, well, sticky.  I have ordered sticky rice at other places and it never compares to Wild Thaiger.  I am happy to have leftovers for lunch tomorrow!

Absolutely loved this place. Went here last night with my family after seeing it the day before on DDD. Great food and a great atmosphere.

We started off our meal with the Dragon Eggz. They come either steamed or fried, we did 1/2 and 1/2 so that we could try both textures. Would definitely suggest doing that again.

We ordered the Seafood Panang, which was good for two people to share.

Other members in our party ordered the Mu Yang (the sauce is amazing), Galee Gai and the Holy Basil Chicken.

After everything the wait staff brought us the More Mango Cheesecake which was complete sin in every bite.

We all left the restaurant full and with nothing but good things to say.


*CAVEAT*
The only thing I would forewarn is that the wait is a little long and service is at times a little bit slow. That's what kept this from getting that elusive 5th star.

Craving Thai, I wasn't willing to drive all the way up to Siam Thai, on 51st Ave and Northern, to get my fix and I had yet to try the Thai my own neighborhood had to offer. Deciding on Wild Thaiger, I chose to save Thai Hut for another time. 

They offer ample parking behind the restaurant and patio dining if you so choose. Seeing no one out on the patio (yea it was warm out but not that uncomfortable), I entered the restaurant and was greeting and seated quickly, choosing a spot at the bar. 

Thai iced tea in hand I reviewed the menu. Hummm, ok pretty standard menu, but being a fan of curries I noted my choices were limited. I guess I could have had them sub the beef for chicken in the dishes but I wasn't feeling up for the hassle. 
After a process that seemed like forever, I decided to start off with the Tofu Towers Appetizer and settled on the Green Curry with beef. 

The tofu towers were well presented with a cucumber "chutney" / salad that was fresh with a vinegarette that still didn't do much for the tofu. [The same cucumber salad vinegarette at Siam Thai is more clean and crisp.] While green curry's are not generally my favorite (I often find them bland and less flavorful than a red), the beef green curry was tasty. The heat was one that built up slowly as you ate but was never overwhelming to the overall dish. The jasmine rice was cooked perfectly. 

While overall I can't complain, I can say I have had better but it is a worthy option when seeking a quick Thai fix. Still craving a good curry I guess I know what I will be making at home this weekend. Or maybe I will try Thai Hut.

I honestly don't understand all the raves about this place.  I saw it reviewed on PBS last Sunday and thought I'd give it a try.  It was pretty Meh for me.  Certainly not worth the drive across town.  I ordered the Tom Ka Gai and their basil chicken.  The chicken in both were like shoe leather--so tough I had to pull out the chunks of chicken and cut saw them with my knife.  While the seasoning was pretty good in the soup it was very very thin and watery and there was a TON of strips of lemon grass in it that I had to try and pull out---like I had a total pile of lemon grass on a napkin when I was finished.  The  basil chicken was not much better.  Watery sauce and minimal flavoring.  

I lived in Bangkok for two years.  Honestly, the best food there is from street vendors.  This place was far from good Thai food.

Galee gai is the cure-all for allergies, the flu or a hangover. Trust me, I know hangovers.
The waitresses are all amazing and beautiful and nice.
Friday and Saturday nights usually yield an awkward wait (who was really here first?).
I have never had a bad meal or experience here.

I've been here a few times and each time was amazing! 
The pad Thai is worth writing home about and the temple of fire has just the right amount if spice.

Not only is the food, good it is also consistent. The service is friendly and never keeps you waiting too long!

Authentic Thai restaurant with specialty dishes that are truly unique. I love this place because I can bring friends and family knowing they have basic dishes to adventurous ones. Service can be spotty when it's busy but the food makes it worth it.

Delicious chicken pad Thai. Fresh ingredients, perfect mixture of noodles, meat, and veggies (for me, but my son would have liked more meat). I asked for spicier the 2nd time I ate it and they brought out some type of spicy sauce to add. I was disappointed because I like my spice cooked in. Perhaps they didn't trust me that I would eat it spicier? I made a ginger garlic chicken stir fry this week and I sliced 5 large jalapeos in it and it was fine. I'm okay with a little more spice.
Man oh man wow this is some of the best Thai food I've ever had not much to say as I need to be carried out of here due to my food coma enjoy the pics.

This was my second time coming to this resturant and my husband's first,  and it will most certainly not be our last! We were quickly seated and drinks were promptly served. There was a short wait on our food, but it was great and well worth the wait. We ordered chicken spring rolls, chicken curry, chicken pad thai, and 2 drinks.  Our total came out to $32.22, not bad at all. We will be back soon!
Great food but service is just, meh.  Had to refill my own water twice.  Too bad this place has potential to be great but employees don't seem to care.

Showed up at 8:10 pm on a Saturday night. There were three larger parties (about 8 people each) seated; otherwise the place was mostly empty. Two waitresses ignored us, one cleaning a table that was obviously not needed. 

After waiting for about five minutes, I asked one of the waitresses about being seated. She said she would get a hostess. 

The hostess comes out and explained that we wouldn't be seated for about 30 minutes because of the large party that just arrived. Because the restaurant was about 70% empty and they wouldn't seat us, we left. 

I realize that this restaurant was featured on the Food Network so I'm assuming the food is great; however, if a hostess doesn't seat guests in a nearly-empty restaurant, I also assume they don't want to serve us.

I cannot believe I haven't reviewed this place! I have been here a handful of times and each time it has been consistently good. My favorite item is the 24 K curry, which is a spicy green curry that features some delicious veggies (japanese eggplant that is melt in your mouth (probably the best eggplant I've ever had... I don't typically like eggplant), squash, and green beans). I usually add chicken and have more than enough food for two meals. Wild Thaiger has decent specials on some nights of the week for drinks (Mondays feature 5$ martinis). My only complaint about the Thaiger is that, unlike other Thai restaurants, they do not allow you to choose your spiciness level. I understand that some dishes may be better spicy or mild, but I would like to have the option available. I would say that Wild Thaiger is the best Thai food I have had in the downtown area and would recommend it.

December - You might need to be patient with the new cook. The service, recipes, and patio are still 5-Star, but some of the dishes are a little shaky. Wild Thaiger has always been spot-on with their staff, so I'm certain he'll be amazing in no time.

Two Words. Holy Basil !!!
p.s  thai spicy...
This was amazing. We saw it on diners, drive-ins and dives and had to go try it out. It did not disappoint

Wow! This restaurant was on our list of go-to's from being on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. We were not disappointed whatsoever :) We got steamed dragon eggz, shrimp pad thai, and pad sei-ew. All three were absolutely amazing, we're definitely coming back!

This restaurant has great pad Thai as well as other dishes to offer. It has a good heart missand I like going to actually sit and eat there. It's a little bit pricey but not too bad and it's in a good location.
Food:  the Tom Yum Goog soup (with shrimp and chicken) is a food score 10 - a Phoenix, AZ best dish.

Wow what a great flavor for the dishes we had it was nearly impossible to stop eating even after our belly was completely full. The waiter was really great as well knew the food and had been there since the place opened. He gave is great recommendations all super delish. It was a really positive experience we will go back!

Every time I've been to Wild Thaiger the food has been amazing, and last night was no different. My friend and I went to check out the "Wine Down Wednesday" special, which means you can get any international wines for only $5 per glass (this is a great deal as they have some pretty awesome wines). 

As for food last night, we shared an app and entree. We started with the Island Crab, which is a crispy shell with crab meat on top - like a deconstructed wonton type of thing, only better! I love the fact that you can see and taste huge delicious chunks of crab, instead of the typical 95% cream cheese filling in most crab wontons. Awesome. For our 'entree' we had a special for the evening that was Thai Sausage and vegetables. It was yummy, and I was even afraid to 'dive in' because the presentation was gorgeous! 

In previous experiences here I've had Pad Thai, Holy Basil Chicken, Peanut Passion and Beef Mangone. All of them were awesome, beautifully presented and my personal favorite... tasted FRESH! I love that every time I've been here the food has been consistently awesome. Fresh flavors, enough spice to taste (you can pick your level on most items), great flavor combos without going overboard - I like that you can taste all the different ingredients instead of having them masked by one or two overpowering flavors. 

Last night I had the privilege of meeting the owner, Olashawn. She's an awesome woman with a passion for what she does, and one of the most down-to-earth people I've ever met. If you go in, make sure to give her a wave, you'll see her behind the counter and behind the line, cooking and working just as hard if not harder then everyone else.

Really surprised to hear of the Sanitation issue in November... but more the way that person was treated, if that's how it went down.  Will be cautious, but will still go.  GREAT lunch... a bit slow sometimes, but if you have 45 min or so, it's fabulous.  REALLY good vegetarian panang... YUM.

I love going to Thaiger! The food is always great; I have never been disappointed. It's also in a cool location and has a very unique atmosphere on the inside. Best Thai food in Phoenix in my opinion.
Had the papaya salad and the Pad Thai. Both were very good. Plus the portions are the right size so I was full without having leftovers....

I used to really like the place, but lately the food has been just okay. and the curries have been a little on the watery side. I am particularly unhappy that Wild Thaier now makes things hot by merely sprinkling dried chili flakes over the entire dish, rather than cooked with the dish. Still, the food is not bad and it's a good lunch.

Let me say that this is by far the best Thai food I have had in Phoenix. The atmosphere is great very friendly staff we were seated right away and made to feel right at home. I had the strawberry Champagne Martini it was very well made. I must say this place is great for a first date anniversary or valentines the owner is wonderful I recommend this place as a romantic spot for a couple. I will continue to go back as long as they are opened.

I saw this in Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives and I had to try it.  I really enjoyed the food! It's probably the best Thai I've had since I moved to Phoenix.  I happened to go with some friends, one of whom ran her own Thai restaurant. She agreed the food was excellent. We had to ask for the spice rack which was fine. And then she doctored our pad see-ew with jalapeo vinegar and spices which was delicious. The dragon eggs in particular were fabulous. The satay, basil chicken, panang curry, and mango sticky rice were great as well. The only item we didn't enjoy was the Papaya salad which was missing fish sauce. I will be back!

This restaurant is definitely a place you want to come to to eat some dishes with vibrant flavors. The dishes we ordered had great flavors and had the right amount of spice. Expect to wait for about 15-20 minutes to be seated, we went on a Sunday night and it felt like we had to wait forever! I would make reservations before coming here.

My 2nd time here, last time was part of a big group, this time was much better! Able to relax and enjoy it! Had kimow chicken and must warn, it hot! But I like my Thai food hot!! My date ,he had the beef panang(red curry beef) also had Thai iced tea for drinks, definitely needed something cold and refreshing!! and for dessert, omg! Had lemon ginger cheescake, was fantastic!!  Love this place and plan to return!!

Ordered takeout from here last night and was disappointed.  The portion size for the chicken curry was very small and I asked to add extra vegetables to the curry (bc otherwise it only comes with potatoes and onions) and didn't see that they had added any.  The amount of rice they provided with the curry was also teeny tiny.  On top of that, a takeout order takes 35 minutes (I ordered at 5:20 pm, not a peak time).  Also they were out of mango for their sticky rice and didn't have any alternatives like custard or anything to serve with the sticky rice.  Meh, never ordering takeout from here again.
Fantastic, got a Hot Soup Tom gun going I believe, very tasty, ended with some fantastic Thai ice coffee and average coconut ice cream, ask for Fawn, she is very attentative and sweet

Solid Thai food.  The food was spicier than I'm used to, and the options included oddities such as Catfish Prigking (super spicy Catfish that I had to chase with tons of Sangria) and the 24K curry (absolutely delicious but still burn-on-both-ends hot).  My friend had Pad Cha Seafood, which also burned beautifully.  I'm guessing this is what Thai food is really like in Thailand (minus the large amounts of seafood), though, so I'll stop complaining.  I'm a spice whimp.

The place is a little expensive and the portions are a little small, but I think the $4 Sangria more than made up for that.

All in all, would totally return.

It was Guy that sparked my interest in this place with Triple D then the moment the fried dragon eggs touched my taste buds I had no choice but to become a lifetime member of the Wild Thaiger fan club. My stomach is growling just thinking about their insanely delicious food. From the Penang Curry to the Papaya Salad its the best Thai I've ever had and I've had a lot of Thai food. On rare occasions I can't remember if the staff was any good or not because I'm so into the food, this is one of those places. I can't say enough about the food here, I might add that the presentation is rather good as well. 

5 Star without hesitation.

I've had better.  

 My wife and I were very excited to try this place based on reviews. The staff was very nice, but a little slow it seemed. 

Our food took a very long time to come out to us, and one of the appetizers showed  up along with the entrees.

I was pumped to try the Decha Boar, not only because it was boar, but it was listed as being "Thai Spicy". Everything is presented nicely, but nice presentation doesn't make up for taste. When my entree came out, the meat was very dry, and it was about as spicy as canned Rosarita spicy refried beans, which means it wasn't.  My wife told me that her Seafood Panang was relatively bland.  The best things we had that night were the appetizers, which were seafood pancake and dragon eggs.  We may go back one day, but it will be way off in the future.  

If you want good Thai food that will satisfy without all the overdone presentation, just go to Sala Thai.

Had the Chicken Lettuce Wraps -- that was Great! (Wanted more but had to stop myself)

Panag was good, others tried Pad Thai. Overall food quality was good, service was pleasant and quick. Great spot for dinner after work. The price was on point too.

I dunno...  the rest of the people at my table all had the Pad Thai, and all of them said it was excellent.  I had the seafood panang curry and thought that it was kind of dull and flavorless...  I really didn't like the presentation where I had to kind of help the rice find it's way to the curry and the seafood on the dish.  It looked fantastic, but when you aren't provided a spoon to do any pouring, it becomes a little awkward.

The service was great.  The iced tea was weird.  No WiFi...  Eh...  I've had better, but this restaurant was very convenient...
Not very spicy, which is a negative for a thai place, but excellent in every other way. Great flavors, well-prepared, great service, good outdoor seating with misters.
