Weak 4. Very pretty restaurant, nice staff and ample parking space behind the restaurant. The sake cosmo is really good. The freshie rolls are excellent - I love the chicken and shrimp combo, the fresh mint, and the delicious peanut sauce. I thought the Kao Pad Jay was really good - the tofu was cooked well, and the rice was really rich and delicious. The vegetables in the dish were room temperature and cooler relative to the rice, so I'm wondering if they used frozen veggies rather than fresh (or maybe a combo). Good, but not sure I would get it again. The pad thai was yummy and beautifully plated. I can see myself coming back.

Ample parking in back, but spaces are narrow.
Food is delicious.
Prices are a bit higher on average for Thai places I've been to around town.

This place is really our favorite Thai restaurant in Phoenix area by far. The corn fritter appetizer is so yummy and I love their pad thai, which I usually get vegetarian with tofu. I have not had any veggie pad thai that is better anywhere else!  Wish it were closer to us, we'd go a lot more often if it was.
Love the accommodating menu and atmosphere.. I can't wait to go back, I'm already craving their chicken basil.. umm umm good!!

Great Satay and pretty good Pad Thai!

What really got me though was how much Guy Fieri I saw.... as if he didn't already haunt all of our dreams already!

As I dined on my chicken pad Thai noodles slowly turned into his frosted tips and that's all I could think about. 

Overall Wild Thai was a good experience but, even a little bit of Guy Fieri is A LOT.

Stopped in for lunch and was decently impressed with this place. Had the green curry which wasn't Thai hot like I had asked but still somewhat spicy. Was disappointed that they did not bring/have fish sauce with Thai chili peppers to add some more salty spiciness to the curry. Impressed that there was not a selection of meats for each of the curries, they are specific to each and was cooked excellently and especially tender. Looking forward to trying some more traditional Thai dishes from here again.

I have been a fan of Wild Thaiger since 2006!! This is some of the most scrumptious thai food i have had hands down in the Phoenix area.  You HAVE to have the thai iced tea, peanut chicken, and the veggie rolls...yummmm.

The only negative is I recently went there on the weekend and the service was HORRIBLY slow because they only had one server for the whole restaurant, although small.  Im not sure if this was just an unusual day or what because during the week they are speedy.

Love this place!

I went to wild Thaiger for dinner with three friends and although the service was good in a clean environment, the food was disappointing. The flavors and preparation is just not authentic. I am reviewing the food with the background of having traveled to Thailand and having lived most of my life in larger culturally diverse cities (NY, Chicago, DC) with close authentic thai food. Here are some critiques:

Pad Kee Mao - My favorite noodle dish of all time is supposed to be prepared with thick rice noodles sauteed to a variety of textures, and infused with a dizzying array of spice. Instead, the dish here is made with thin vermacilli noodles and tasted like a lump of wet ricey dough. I even explicitly asked for it to be extra spicy, but there was barely any.

Pad thai - This basic Thai staple was presented as a soggy clump of noodles with a watery sauce pooling at the bottom of the plate. The worse part was that despite all of that sauce, it was tasteless except for the peanuts sprinkled on top. There was no hint of tamarind or fish sauce or chili. Disgrace.

Tom Yum (chicken) - Again, what we received was a flavorless broth. There was no taste of lemongrass, no curry, and the chicken was dry.

Needless to say, this was very disappointing. For a large restaurant in a prominent location, the food served up here was worse than some of the shacks I've eaten out of in other cities.

Two stars for service and cleanliness alone, none for food.

Only because I can't give them 0 stars. They really need to get it together. Supposedly they do not take reservations, but they were unable to seat us. This would be fine if they didn't have 5 empty "reserved" tables. (In fact, we were told there was no where to even wait and when we tried to order a beer at the bar, we were told that someone might be able to get it in 5-10 minutes. After 15 minutes we gave up and went outside without so much as a water.) The hostess let us know several times that they were understaffed, but with only 12 tables and 4 waitstaff it shouldn't have been an issue.  40 minute of standing around and they finally pulled together two open tables and sat our "large party" of 5. They then proceeded to tell us that it would "be a while" until someone would be out to take our order, and no they wouldn't be able to take our drink orders now. Then, we had to watch while our server took orders from a party of 13 who weren't even completely seated yet! At this point, we took the hint and headed over to the Phoenix Public Market Cafe!! I don't care if they are featured on every food network show, until they figure out how to run a restaurant (and lose the attitude) we won't be back!

We came here in between the shows of Angels in America at Phoenix Theatre.  Although not large they were able to get us seated very quickly.  The rest if the service was not very fast or attentive but once the food arrives it didn't matter.  My hubby got yellow curry which he though very good and the presentation with cabbage curls was lovely.  I had the Island Fried Rice and it was a perfect portion of rice with fruit, veggies and rice.  In addition the presentation for this was beautiful.  The drinks were good and we had the wonderful cocnut ice cream which on that hot summer day tasted and felt so very good.  The food is wonderful here and the decor is very nice as well.  The cook mingled in the small restaurant which was nice.   There was a long by the time we left.  Had the service been better they might have got 5 stars.

Living in Chandler I never would have found this place unless I had to meet a friend who was in town staying near by.  I read many reviews and even with many complaining about the service, we gave it a try.

First upon arriving I was met by a friendly hostess, who offered to get me a beer while I waited for my friend.  When I went to pay she said don't worry, it will be added on your bill. Now I like that in a place!

When seated our server (huge smile) immediatley was there offering all of us more drinks, so far I find nothing like those that have complained.

Since it was a Friday during lent my friend could not have meat so we ordered with our drinks the veg sampler app.  It came and was fantastic and most suprisingly light.  I ordered as a main the seafood panang and it was so good.  The panang sauce had great flavor with a  nice touch of heat on the backside.  None of it remained.  My friend ordrered the mango shrimp and ate every bite of that.

Finally anyone who does not have mango and sticky rice at a Thai joint is nuts in my opinion so of course we ordered that.  Just delicious!  

So this place is legit, good service and good food.  I would if I could give it 4.5 stars.

I like this place. Although it gets really busy around noon. My favorite dish is gapraogui. I love how the kitchen is visable, while you are dining, and you dont smell like the kitchen when you leave. I mostly go for the food, its not a place I would hang out there with people and drink.

OK I loved Wild Thaiger before, but the recent changes to the menu are PHENOMENAL!!! The corn fritters are like crispy crunchy clouds of YUM!!  I love that they WILL custom spice anything. And the coconut water adult beverage is absolutely SCRUMPTIOUS 
The service is good, not Great, but not in any way bad. This is a FAVORITE
Good flavor but the ribs were like room temperature. The dragon balls are worth the drive !!!!!

We were visiting the Heard museum and we decided to stop in for lunch, it was during the week, it was a great meal. We split the chicken pad thai and had some spring rolls. Great service and the place was busy, which is always a plus in my eyes. I would love to come and check out this place for happy hour, I have a feeling it would be a good time. I'll be back the next time I'm in Phoenix.

My friend Ric told me about this place, although he had never been there. Upon walking through the door, you are greeted by a life-size poster of Guy Fierri (?) and apparently this place made it to Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, one of my favorite shows and I missed this episode! Who has time for TV anyway? I enjoyed the swanky upscale interior design but this also led me to conclude that it would be a pricy experience. I was right. As it is hard to put a price on a great experience, the food was SOOOO good that I would have gladly paid double! I brought my folks with me a couple weeks after my first visit - they loved it too. Among the dishes we enjoyed: Spring rolls (pictured), the specialty Holy Basil Chicken (Thai green chili, Garlic, and Aromatic Basil $11.95), the Tom Ka Gai soup (Traditional spices, chicken, mushrooms, coconut soup) $9.95 ... and, of course, the Thai Iced Tea. On my next visit I want to try the Volcano Wraps (Insane chicken wraps with lemongrass, ginger, and thai chilies. Hot! $7.95), and also the Tom Yum Goong soup (Hot and spicy shrimp with mushrooms and tomatoes - $13.95) and finally, the Mi Dang Dang (Red BBQ pork, Soba noodles, sweet sauce, sprouts, Hard boiled egg - $10.95) but hey, that's on my next visit. Mouth is watering now. The food tastes BETTER than the photos look on their website, which is a mind-blowing paradox. Believe the hype this time, you'll see - just go. This is one of the best restaurants in Phoenix.
Food is fantastic. Dragon eggs and Basil chicken my faves. Had at least 10 different items off the menu and enjoyed if family style. Great service and can't wait to go back.
This is some of the best Thai food I have ever eaten. We got a hot pot that was delicious and chicken pad Thai. We will definitely be back. Forgot to take pictures we were too excited to eat
Great service and okay food. I ordered 5-Spicy level ( where 4 is Thai hot) and the food came out tasting sweet. I love La's Thai on McDowell and Hayden much better

Years past, Wild Thaiger was a moribund place serving bland, forgettable fare so I barely recognized it when our party of six stopped in last night for my mom's birthday. 

White tablecloth, good cutlery, big wine glasses, open kitchen, spicy dishes presented with flair - I'm impressed! I had beef Kiewan, a delicious green curry that packed solid (American-gauge) heat. The corn fritters are crunchy and good, served with jalapenos and cucumber. The coconut milk-based soup with chicken was a hit around the table. Pork, beef, ribs, vegetarian, salmon - everything got a solid thumbs up. 

Good drinks. Our server was first rate and unusually sweet. Maybe it's not cutting edge Scottsdale, but Wild Thaiger serves up tongue tingling food at fair prices in an attractive interior space.  They've stepped up, and if you're in the neighborhood, you should too.
